Naomi is the group's secretary.  She's 37 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been selling food for the past 19 years and works for INABIF.  She makes chocoteja in her spare time.  Her greatest desire is to have a fast food restaurant.  She will use the money from this loan to buy chairs and tables.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Naomi is the first one on the left.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy party materials to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and with their personal, household and business expenditures. She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs, which are needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to meet their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Julieta hopes that her business will have another branch and dreams that her children will have a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs, which are needed in her business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 61-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She and her husband Marlito, a fisherman, are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday needs and to support their children, who are still studying.

Linda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Linda also has a canteen and a reloading station for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 900 in sales every day.

Linda is requesting a Php 25,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Linda hopes that her business will continue to grow, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Abante

texts.en:
Abante is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Abante works very hard to provide for them.

Abante runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, egg, soap, noodles, etc.

Abante has been in this business for one year.

In the future Abante would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, egg, soap and noodles.

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena works hard to support her family. Morena is married and has a business selling pearl accessories in the Philippines.

Morena requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pearls for her business.

Morena has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Morena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pearls for her business.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emilyn is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emilyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Emilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Emilyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
This is Precila. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the grocery items for her variety store. She has been in this business for five years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. She is also involved in a farming business where she grows plants and then sells them. She is more focused now on her plant business.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time of 30,000 PHP so she can buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Precila dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family will have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 38 years old, married with five children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates an agricultural business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to pay for the labor required to produce coconuts. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for labor to produce coconuts.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали 45 лет. Он женат. У него три сына и три дочери, которые учатся в школе и в институте. Сафарали уже год занимается животноводством, а именно куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает коров и телят, и после 30 дней откармливания, продает их на скотном рынке с наценкой. В разведении скота ему помогает жена. Сафарали запрашивает кредит для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Safarali is 45 years old and married. He has three sons and three daughters who are all attending school or college. Safarali has been raising cattle for a year for meat sales. He purchases cows with calves and feeds them for 30 days then sells the animals on the livestock market with a profit. His wife helps Safarali take care of the animals. Safarali is requesting a loan to purchase more animals for his business. He is planning to use the profits to improve the living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for future resale

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi est une femme âgé(e) de 37ans. Mariée à un transitaire, elle est mère de 02 enfants âgés de 10 et 06ans. Akuvi travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2002. Elle achète les condiments, ignames et autres à Lomé et répond à la demande de la population dans un bar. Elle est aidée par 10 employés et n’a pas de difficultés principales. Akuvi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames, des condiments et autres. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et disposer d’autres lieux de vente.
texts.en: Akuvi is a 37 year old woman. Married to a freight forwarder, she is the mother of two children aged six and ten years. Akuvi has worked as a cook since 2002. She buys seasonings, yams, and other items in Lome and serves her customers in a pub. She is assisted by ten employees and doesn't have any major difficulties. Akuvi requested her fourth loan from WAGES in order to buy yams, seasonings, and other items. She wants to reinvest in her business and make other sales locations available to her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings for her restaurant

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is married with two children. Marlita is 55 years old and from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Marlita owns and operates a general store to make a living and she's been in this business for three years. Each month she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soaps etc. Marlita been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Marlita wants to build house and to see her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is an industrious bachelor who is engaged in selling slippers in his community. Because of the poor standard of living he had before, he works hard. He doesn’t want to fall back into poorer living. He is 42 years old and wishes for a good life and a brighter future. 

Therefore, he is asking for a loan of an amount of PHP 40,000 to buy shoes, sandals and slippers as additional goods to sell.  He hopes this will lead to a boom in his income and will allow his business to prosper and his living standards as well.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, and slippers.

loans.name: Hanelyn

texts.en:
Hanelyn works hard to support her family. Hanelyn is married and has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines.

Hanelyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

Hanelyn has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Hanelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 49 years old and married with four children who are in school. Divina works very hard to provide for them.

Divina runs a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to sell.

Divina has been in this business for six years.

In the future Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 39 years old. She is engaged in a piggery business and has been doing this for almost 20 years, earning an average amount of PHP 10,000 every six months. This is carefully used and maximized for her family. 

This is the sad part of gaining low income. Zenaida really needs to budget every single coin. She wants to earn a higher profit by asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 as additional working capital to buy pigs, vitamins, and feed. She hopes this will provide a fitting lifestyle for her family.  

Zenaida has two children who are currently studying. As of now, she is working hard to earn money for their daily living, especially for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs, vitamins, and feed for her piggery business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Мадина имеет умелые руки. Она шьёт очень красивые национальные женские платья. Так как она не имеет детей и мужа, она обеспечивает себя сама. Она имеет  2 швейных машинок, и теперь она хочет организовать свой бизнес шитьем и продажей женских одежд на местном рынке. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От данного бизнеса она получила много новой информации для организации бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки тканей для организации нового бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту. Это ее первый займ и она обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Madina is a hardworking woman. She is divorced and has now children. Madina is very skilled with her hands - she can sew beautiful national Tajik dresses. As she has no children and no husband, she is taking care of herself by herself. She owns two sewing machines and now wants to organize a sewing business and sell her garments at the local market. Madina received a certificate after taking the "Achieve Success" class organized by the Association of Businesswomen. This class has taught her much about managing and budgeting. Madina is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase fabrics for her sewing studio. She awaits your kindness. This is her first loan and she promises to repay everything on time.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for organizing a new business

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо женщина с доброй душой. Ей 44 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Доход ее мужа не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. С целью получения дохода 2 месяца назад, она начала свой бизнес купле продажи продуктов питания на местном рынке. С целью улучшения своих навыков, она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она получила много новой информации о бизнесе. Она очень старается развивать свой бизнес, но для пополнения оборотного капитала она не имеет денег. Она обратилась за займом в ИМОН для получения займа в сумме 2000 сомони для покупки продуктов питания. Этот займ поможет ей развивать новый бизнес. Она обещает погасить займ во время. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulaykho is a woman with a kind sol. She is 44 years old, married and is raising one child. Her husband's income is insufficient to provide the family with all the necessities. To increase the family's profits Zulaykho started her own grocery store two years ago at the local market. To become an expert businesswoman she attended and was certified by the "Achieve Success" course offered by the Association of Businesswomen. The course taught her many new things about managing a business. Zulaykho is determined to become successful, but she needs to have more cash capital to make bulk purchases for her store.  She has turned to IMON for a loan of 2000 somoni which she will use to purchase groceries for resale in her store. This loan will help her develop her new business. She promises to repay the loan on time and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy bulk groceries for starting new business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil. Ella empezó cortando cabello a domicilio, poco a poco fue mejorando su negocio con mas servicios como tinturado etc. Hace años atras cuando se caso y tuvo una niña comenzo mas formal su negocio. Pero la cliente ha estado superandoce a pesar de que en la actualidad no esta casada y tiene su hija de 4 años. 

La cliente corta cabello a mujeres y hombre, hace tinturados de cabellos, pedicura y manicura. Su dificultad para hacer su trabajo con normalidad es la salud ya que cuando recae tiene que quedarse en la casa ya que ella es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida)

Con el prestamo va a comprar plancha de cabello, tinturados, peinillas etc. Su sueño es poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  She started cutting hair at home.  Little by little she was improving her business with more services like dyeing, etc.  Years ago, when she got married and had a daughter, she started her business more formally.

The client, however, has been improving herself in spite of not now being married and having a four year old daughter.

The client cuts women’s and men’s hair, dyes hair, and does pedicures and manicures.  The difficulty that she has in doing her work normally is her health.  When she has a relapse she has to stay in the house.  She is a PVVS (patient living with HIV/AIDS).

She will use the loan to buy a hair iron, dyes, and combs, etc.

Her dream is to be able to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy a hair iron, dyes, and combs, etc.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Ablavi vit avec son conjoint et leur enfant de 04ans à Lomé. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle à démarré la vente des produits alimentaires, des pagnes et des mèches dans une boutique. Activité qu’elle mène depuis 2011. Ayant des clients de parts et d’autres de la ville de Lomé et n’arrivant plus à les satisfaire, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra d’agrandir sa boutique et d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en: Ablavi lives with her spouse and their four year old child in Lome. To lend a strong hand to her spouse in the household expenses, she started selling food products, pagnes (colorful wax cloth) and hair extensions in a store. She has had this business since 2011. Having clients from various parts of Lome and not being able to satisfy them anymore, she is asking for a first loan to buy merchandise. The profits from these sales will allow her to grow her store and provide for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful wax cloth), hair extensions, and food products

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes batiques et des habits de façon ambulante depuis 2002, Amélé est une dame de 42ans qui approvisionne chez les grossistes qui viennent des pays frontaliers. Elle désire avoir un emplacement fixe c’est pour cela, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra de louer une boutique pour éviter de se promener.
texts.en: A traveling saleswoman of batik pagnes (colorful wax cloth) since 2002, Amélé is a 42 year old woman. She stocks up from the wholesalers who come from bordering countries. She wants to have a fixed business location. It is for this reason that she is asking for a first loan to buy more merchandise. The profit from her sales will allow her to rent a store to avoid walking around to do business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful wax cloth) and clothing

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married with thirteen children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell for her business.

Alicia has borrowed and paid seventeen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business of buying and selling recycled materials for six years and also earns an income from a general store.

Alicia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell for her business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 31 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Elma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to re-stock her store with food and household goods like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, etc.

In the future, Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods like canned goods, eggs, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 27 years old and married. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Daisy owns and operates a services business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over four years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for printing. 

Daisy wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for printing.

loans.name: Genevi

texts.en:
Genevi is married and has five children. She is 38 years old and four of her children are in school. Genevi is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Genevi has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, Genevi would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money that she can afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel is 31 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a transportation service business in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over three years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. 

Mitchel joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and new tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business for house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Jiminez, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a transportation service business to earn a living. She has been in this business for over five years and earns 4,000PHP every month. 

Rose joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires. She hopes to be able to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Buhojal

texts.ru:
Бухочал трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 43 лет.  К великому несчастью несколько лет тому назад  Бухочал потеряла  своего мужа, он умер от тяжелой болезни.     Все эти годы она не падая духом, старается поддерживать свою семью и всегда работает не покладая рук. Бухочал занимается откормом скота. Этим делом она начала заниматься после того как умер ее муж.    У нее есть дочка которая работает в школе.  Они живут вместе. Дочка тоже вносит свой вклад в бюджет семьи.   
У Бухочал есть племянник,который помогает выводить скот на продажу.  Каждый месяц  племянник выводит готовых скотов на рынок и сразу же покупает молодых.  Этот бизнес дает очень хороший доход. Бухочал очень благодарна племяннику за помощь.  Дополнительно она выращивает огурцы и помидоры.  На данный момент Бихочал планирует купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.   С этой целью Бухочал обратилась в Арванд за кредитом.
texts.en: Buhojal is a hardworking 43 year old woman. Unfortunately, she has lost her husband a few years ago to a terminal illness and is now a widow. All these years without him Buhojal was trying not to loose her spirit and support her family, so she has worked without rest. Buhojal's trade is raising cattle and she took over this business from her diseased husband. Her only daughter works in the local school and they are still living together. Buhojal's daughter also supplements the family's budget. Buhojal's nephew is responsible for taking the cattle for resale at the livestock market. Every month he drives the mature animals to the market and immediately buys new calves for feeding. Buhojal's business has been yielding good profits and she is grateful to her nephew for the help. Aside from cattle, Buhojal also grows tomatoes and cucumbers for sale. Currently Buhojal wants to expand her herd and so has turned to Arvand for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам житель города Куляб, расположенный в южной части Таджикистана. Он занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Ему 52 года. Он женат и имеет троих дочерей и одного сына. Его жена работает в отделе связи города Куляб, а дети учатся в школе. Рустам перевозит пассажиров по маршруту город Куляб - город Душанбе. В день он делает один рейс. Рустам является опытным таксистом, так как в этой сфере он уже 30 лет. Сейчас он намерен расширить свою деятельность. Он запрашивает кредит для покупки автомашины Камаз.
texts.en: Rustam is a resident of Kulob in southern Tajikistan. He is a 52 year old taxi driver. Rustam is married and has three daughters and a son. His wife works at the Kulob phone company and his children attend school. Rustam drives passengers between Kulob and Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. He is able to do one round trip per day. Rustam is an experienced driver and has worked in this trade for 30 years. Now he wants to expand his business and is requesting a loan to purchase a large Kamaz truck.

loans.use: to purchase a Kamaz truck

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 42 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муххабат живет в дальнем регионе, где основной доход является земледелием и скотоводством. Мухаббат более 15 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как помидор, рис, пшеница и другие зерновые культуры. Ее муж не помогает ей введение бизнеса, так как он имеет свой бизнес и занят своим делом. Ее дочь и невестка помогают ей введение бизнеса. Она выращивает в 0,50 га земли пшеницу и на 0,10 га земли помидор. Она выращивает два раза в год, то есть весной она делает посев помидора и пшеницы, а осенью кукуруз и рис. Она довольно своим делом и является повторной клиенткой в ИМОН. Она потратила все свои деньги на нужды семьи и теперь не имеет денег, чтобы купить семена и минеральные удобрения для нового посева. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони и обещает погасить займ вовремя.
texts.en: Muhabbat is 42 years old. She is married and has three children. Muhabbat lives in a remote region where the main ways of life are farming and raising livestock. Muhabbat has been growing various crops, such as tomatoes, rice, wheat and other grains for more then 15 years now. Her husband does not help her as he has his own business and is busy. However, her daughter and her daughter-in-law do help take care of the crops. Muhabbat grows 0.5 hectare of wheat and 0.1 hectare of tomatoes. She brings in two harvests per year, because she plants wheat and tomatoes in the spring and corn and rice in the fall. She loves her farm and is a repeated client with IMON. Muhabbat is requesting this loan because she spent all her savings for family needs this year and needs to purchase seeds and fertilizer for spring planting. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for her land where she grows wheat and tomatoes

loans.name: María Belis

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez; lo aprendió de sus padres quienes fueron los pioneros en enseñar a sus hijos a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su familia. Hoy en día manifiesta que con su trabajo se puede defender económicamente, ya que también esta cultivando hortalizas y desea ampliar el área de cultivo. 

Los insumos agrícolas, así como el alimento para su familia los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a treinta y cinco minutos de su casa, es decir a dos horas y media en autobús; el transporte es bien escaso y debe esperar mucho tiempo para efectuar el viaje. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos bolsas de semilla de maíz, 16 quintales de abono y para pago de mano de obra. Con la inversión se ahorra varios viajes a la ciudad, lo que le permitirá ahorrar; para ahorrar y brindarle el estudio a su hijo para que sea un profesional y ampliar al mismo tiempo su producción de hortalizas.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old. She has a son. She has worked in agriculture since childhood. She learned it from her parents who were homesteaders teaching their children to work in order to help make a living. Today she says that her work is financially viable, and also that she is growing vegetables and wants to expand the farming area. 

The agricultural supplies and food for the family is bought in a city that is thirty five minutes from her home but, that is to say, two and a half hours by bus. Transportation is scare and you must wait a long time in order to make the trip.

The loan that she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy 2 bags of corn seed, 16 quintals of fertilizer and to pay for workers. With the investment she can avoid some of the trips to the city which will allow her to save; to save and to pay student fees for her son so that he will become a professional and to also expand her production of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of corn seed, 16 quintals of fertilizer and to pay for workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products and cooking utensils

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Femme d’un pasteur et maman de 02 enfants âgés de 08 et 03ans, Adjovi est couturière de profession. Elle revend en plus de son activité des pagnes depuis 2009 dans son atelier et de façon ambulante. Manquant de fonds pour acheter des marchandises, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour achat de pagnes. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra d’assurer les besoins primaires de la famille tout en gardant pérenne son activité.
texts.en: The wife of a church leader, and mother of two children aged three and eight years, Adjovi is a seamstress by profession. In addition to her business she has sold pagnes (colorful wax cloth) in her studio and as a traveling salesperson since 2009. Lacking funds to buy merchandise, she is asking for a first loan to buy pagnes. The profit from the sales will allow her to provide for her family's basic needs all the while keeping her business stable.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful wax cloth)

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Âgée de 46ans, Yawa est une veuve et mère de 03 enfants dont 01 sur les bancs d’école.  Elle revend depuis 1992 du riz à ses clients dans les quartiers de la ville de Lomé. afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la famille, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des sacs de riz. Avec le profit, elle espère agrandir son stock et construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en: 46 years old, Yawa is a widow and mother of three children, one of whom is in school. Since 1992 she has sold rice to customers in areas of the city of Lome. In order to better meet her family's needs, she is asking for a second loan from WAGES to buy bags of rice. With the profit she hopes to grow her stock and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice

loans.name: Emilea

texts.fr: Emilea est une femme de 36 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. Elle possède et gère une mini kiosque de vente de poisson fumé, de des épices dans un quartier de la ville depuis 6 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant un sac de poisson afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses profit. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'accroître son capital et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Emilea is a 36 year old unmarried woman and mother of one child. She has had and managed a mini-kiosque where she sells smoked fish and spices in an area of the city for six years. She is asking for a loan to strengthen her stock of raw materials by buying a bag of fish in order to increase her turnover and revenue. The profits generated will allow her to increase her capital and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Gioconda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Gioconda, 49 años de edad, originario de Granada, pero actualmente vive en Managua, acompañado, madre de 3 hijos de 14, 10 y 14 años respectivamente, actualmente los tres están estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de joyas y  cosméticos, de la que es propietaria hace más de 20 años.
Empezó a la edad de 29 años de edad,  con capital propio, dinero que le dio su compañero, inicio vendiendo perfumes de la Avon, de las ganancias que le genera este negocio, decidió emprender otro negocio como es la venta de joyas en el mercado, se siente muy orgullosa porque con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido salir adelante con su negocio, recibe el apoyo de su compañero, sus productos lo comercializa en la misma zona en donde habita. 
Una de sus expectativas es incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias. Gioconda esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar joyas, como cadenas, pulseras, anillos, vitrinas y cosméticos. Ella estima que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar mas mercadería que aun no tiene en inventario y al mismo tiempo podrá  cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Gioconda is 49 years old. She is originally from Granada but she now lives in Managua. She is in a relationship. She is mother of three children who are currently studying. She is a merchant and she sells jewelry and cosmetics. She has been in business for more than 20 years. 
She started her business 29 years ago with her own capital with money from her companion. She started selling Avon perfumes. With the earnings generated from this business, she decided to start another business selling jewelry in the market.  She feels very proud because with a lot of effort and hard work, she has been able to succeed with her business. She receives support from her partner. She sells products in the same area where she lives. 
One of the expectations is to increase her sales in order to earn better profits. Gioconda is requesting a loan to purchase jewelry like chains, bracelets, rings, display cases and cosmetics. She thinks this loan will her help her to purchase more merchandise that she does not have in inventory and at the same time, she can fill orders from her customers.

loans.use: purchase jewelry like chains, bracelets, rings, display cases and cosmetics.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés, se dedica al cultivo de maíz. Él tiene 34 años  de edad, vive en casa propia con sus dos  hijos, ellos tiene 5 y 7 años de edad; trabaja en la agricultura para obtener ingresos que le permitan darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, esto oficio lo realiza de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm, lo aprendió desde muy pequeño con sus padres.  
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y para pagar mano de obra. Este le ayudara a invertir e incrementar la productividad y lograr mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es optimizar la entrada de dinero para darle una vida rentable y digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Moisés, 34, makes a living growing corn.  He lives in his own house with his two children, ages 5 and 7.  He works in agriculture to get more income so he can give his family a better quality of life.  He works Monday through Saturday from 6 a.m. until 12 noon.  He learned the job from his parents when he was very young.

He needs the loan to buy soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide, and to pay for labor.  This will help him invest, increase productivity, and earn more income.

His dream is to make the most of his income to give his family a profitable and decent life.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items such as clothes, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana, a 60-year-old married mother of four children from the town of Baclayon, Bohol, earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store which sells various goods and items to the people in her area.

Victoriana is requesting a loan to buy additional groceries to sell such as canned goods, candies, rice, biscuits, bread, soda, soap and detergents. These purchases will enable her to attract and cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and profit. In the future, Victoriana hopes to make her business a success and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell such as canned goods, candies, rice, biscuits, bread, soda, soap and detergents

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguisseme, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, qui  ont en moyenne 50 ans, 7 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana-coura, commune de Guegneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, d’habits, de poisson et de la banane.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
La cliente AMI, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter des sacs d’oignon, des boîtes de concentrée de tomate, des cubes Magie et du poivre avec les fournisseurs de Bamako, pour ensuite revendre au marché de Fana, au comptant et en détail à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women and widows, who are aged 50 years on average and have an average of seven children each and live in traditional extended families in the city of Fana, in the Fana-coura area, Guegneka commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali). 
They met each other through family ties, neighbors, and friendship. They do business selling seasonings, clothing, fish, and bananas. 
The women of the Djiguisseme group are on their fifteenth group loan.

The borrower Ami, second person from the left, will buy bags of onions, cans of tomato paste, Magie (bouillon) cubes, and pepper from suppliers in Bamako to sell them retail in the market in Fana, for cash and credit to a clientele made up mostly of women. 
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000CFA francs, which will be used for her family's needs, and a portion will be reinvested in her seasoning selling business.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer, aged 45 years, and married with seven children. John is a disabled person with only one active hand. This forced him to drop out of school at an early age due to stigmatization by the other able-bodied pupils, and he decided to concentrate on coffee farming. 

Despite his disability, John has been able to grow two hectares of coffee, which has enabled him to meet his home needs, pay school fees for his children, and put up a permanent residential house. 

His main challenge is that the plantation is now big, and he cannot effectively look after it; he now wants money for buying fertilizers and hiring labor to cultivate it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a 55-year-old mother who lives in a rural community together with her husband and their children. They help each other in cultivating their farm to increase their production and income to satisfy their necessities. 

Due to financial difficulty, Lucrecia engages in making delicacies such as rice cake, tamarind candy and many others that she sells in her village. She aimed to strengthen this business, but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy sugar, coconuts, milk, plastics and other ingredients needed in preparing snack food to sell. 

Through this financial assistance, Lucrecia believes that she will be going to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconuts, milk, plastics and other ingredients needed in preparing snack food for sale.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia, 52 años de edad, una humilde comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y mercadería variada, madre de 1 hijo de 13 años, actualmente esta estudiando.
Para Doña Claudia sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles, la cual empezó vendiendo  prenda de oro, con un poco dinero que tenia ahorrado, pero  luego miro que este negocio no le generaba muchas ganancias, fue allí que decidió dedicarse solo a vender ropa y zapato, de la que se siente muy bien porque este negocio le genera ganancias a diario, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, sus productos los comercializa en las universidades y en los barrios aledaño en donde habita.
Una de sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades de su  clientela. Claudia  esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar mas mercadería como ropa, zapatos, sandalias y cosméticos, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar mas ropa y cumplir con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, dentro de sus planes futuros es establecer una tienda solo de ropa.
texts.en:
Claudia, 52 years old, is an unassuming merchant selling clothing, shoes, and varied merchandise. She is the mother of 1 child, 13 years old, currently a student. 

Claudia’s beginnings were very difficult, which she began by selling gold costume jewelry, with a little money she had saved, but later she saw that this business did not generate much profit, and it was at that point that she decided to dedicate herself to selling clothing and shoes, and she feels very happy because this business generates daily earnings. She has the help of her daughter and her products are sold in universities and in the surrounding neighborhoods where she lives.

One of her expectations is to grow her business to meet customer demand. Claudia is requesting funding in order to buy more merchandise such as clothing, shoes, sandals, cosmetics, etc. She thinks that this loan will help her to buy more clothing and to fulfill the orders customers make. Her future goal is to open a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as clothing, shoes, sandals, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant. Myrna has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from a general store. Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 40 years old and is married with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Beverly has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

Beverly has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Desde hace veinticinco años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, frijol y hortalizas. Pues desde pequeño ha trabajado mucho junto con sus padres. Cabe mencionar que tiene mucha experiencia; ya que en donde cultiva es terreno franco arcilloso y un poco disparejo. Los insumos agrícolas, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a treinta y cinco kilómetros de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una bolsa de semilla de maíz, 8 quintales de abono. Con la inversión podrá comprar los insumos de una sola vez, sin realizar varios viajes a la ciudad. En un futuro desea brindarles el estudio a sus hijos, comprar más terreno y seguir trabajando en la agricultura y trabajar más fuerte en las hortalizas, ya que en donde vive la tierra es muy fértil para esa clase de cultivos.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old, married, and has five children.  He has been farming for the past 25 years, raising corn, beans, and vegetables.  He has worked hard, alongside his parents since he was little.  He has much experience, given that a the land he works is clay and a bit uneven.  He buys his farming supplies in town, which is located 35 kilometers from his home.

He is asking for this loan, through Fundación Campo, so he can buy corn seed and eight hundred pounds of compost.  This investment will allow him to buy his supplies all at once without having to make multiple trips into town.  In the future he wants to provide an education for his children and buy more land, continue working as a farmer, and work harder because the land where he lives is very fertile for these types of crops.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Ascencion

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de sorbetes y helados. Él tiene 30 años de edad, está casado, su esposa tiene 28 años de edad y goza de un hijo, el cual tiene 3 años. El negocio inicia como fuente de ingresos para su hogar, tiene cinco años de poseer el negocio y cuenta con siete empleados, lo realiza de lunes a sábado, este oficio lo aprendió con su hermano. 
El préstamo que requiere le ayudara para comprar paletas, sorbetes, entre otro tipo de helados; asimismo adquirir un fricers. Esta inversión le permitirá incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos.
Su objetivo es fortalecer su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José sells sherbet and ice cream. He is 30 years old and married. His wife is 28 years old and he has a 3 year old son. He began his business as a source of income for the household. He has 5 years experience and has 7 employees, working from Monday to Saturday. He learned this trade with his brother.

He is asking for a loan to help him buy popsicles, sherbet, and other types of ice cream, and also to buy a freezer. This investment will permit him to increase his inventory and obtain higher earnings.

His goal is to strengthen his business and to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, sherbet, and other types of ice cream

loans.name: Ma. Shiela

texts.en:
Ma. Shiela works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell footwear business in the Philippines; she has been doing this for nine years.

Ma. Shiela requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional footwear to sell.

In the future, Ma. Shiela would like to save enough money so she could send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, bags, and other dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to raise, fatten and sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 43 años de edad , esta divorciada y vive en compañía de madre y su hijo de 25 años de edad en la casa de sus padres.El negocio que tiene Lucia es la venta de golosinas en un tablero que instala en el frontis de su casa todos los días. Ofrece a la venta chicles, caramelos, galletas y chocolates. Inició su labor hace 4 años y desde entonces ha logrado ganarse el aprecio y la preferencia de sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Trabaja sola y lo hace con mucho optimismo porque sabe que su trabajo es su única herramienta para obtener todo lo que se propone.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite socializar con su vecinos, además comenta que su trabajo le permite sentirse productiva y generar su propio dinero por lo cual se siente tranquila, actualmente tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, por tanto espera su apoyo financiero para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.Con el monto solicitado comprará galletas, caramelos, chocolates y chicles de diversas marcas para que continúe trabajando en su actividad.
texts.en:
43-year-old Lucia is divorced and lives together with her mother and 25-year-old son in her parents' house.  Her business is selling sweet treats from a wooden board that she sets up outside the front of her house every day.  She sells gum, candies, cookies and chocolate.

Lucia started her business four years ago and, since then, she has managed to gain the respect and loyalty of her customers who are mainly her neighbors.  She works alone and works with a lot of optimism because she knows that her work is the only tool she has for obtaining everything she needs.  She enjoys her work because it allows her to socialize with her neighbors.  She also says that her work allows her to feel productive and make her own money.  This makes her happy.  Lucia currently has plans to expand her business and open a grocery store in her home.

On this occasion, Lucia is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can fulfill her goals.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy different brands of cookies, candies, chocolate and gum so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candies, gum, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 30 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like soft drinks, soap, cream, eggs, spices, etc.. Veronica has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like soft drinks, soap, cream, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ngota Victor

texts.en:
Ngota Victor is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Yei. He is married and has two children, ages 3 and 5. Both of them go to school. Ngota Victor runs a general store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more body lotion and other items for his store. He has no source of income other than this business. 

In five years Ngota Victor would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Ngota Victor says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy body lotion and other items for his store

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 52, married, and has five children, one of whom in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlita has been running a buy and sell bamboo business in the Philippines for six years, and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to sell.

In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, decide optar por un nuevo préstamo porque se le presenta la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de venta de verduras y frutas. Este le permitirá comprar yuca, tomates, pipián, brócoli, coliflor, entre otras verduras; asimismo adquirir, melón, sandía, manzanas,  uvas, entre otras. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Víctor has decided to apply for another loan because he needs to invest more in the business of selling fruit and vegetables. 

It will mean he can buy manioc, tomatoes, squash, broccoli and cauliflower among other vegetables; as well as melon, watermelon, apples, and grapes, among others. 

The last loan helped him to increase his stock and get better profits. His family circumstances and financial conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy manioc, tomatoes, squash, broccoli and  cauliflower among other vegetables; as well as melon, watermelon, grapes, among others.

loans.name: Marinella

texts.es: Marinella de 32 años, habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas,  en un barrio que combina espacios comerciales formales e informales, instalaciones deportivas y recreativas, como uno de los estadios más importantes del balompié colombiano y zonas habitables, estructuradas en edificaciones de apartamentos y de casas, donde habitan familias trabajadoras y la de ella no es la excepción. Marinella aprendió de su madre a ser comerciante y hace 12 años emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, después de haber sido empleada en una empresa y una vez que logró ahorros para iniciar su emprendimiento con mercancías variadas. Su negocio poco a poco fue creciendo, y adecuó sus instalaciones con muebles y enseres para lograr exhibir su oferta. En la actualidad ha aplicado a dos financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado  aumentar el surtido de su negocio y compras en mayor volumen y contar con mayor liquidez y su clientela se ha incrementado. Esta es justamente la razón para acudir a un credikiva, con el cual responderá a los pedidos de su clientela pues su meta de expansión y fortalecimiento son cada vez mayores. Con este crédito comprará ropa, calzado, útiles de papelería, cosméticos entre otros artículos y sus clientes están satisfechos, con la respuesta oportuna de Marinella, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión con potencial de éxito.
texts.en:
Marinella, 32, lives with her spouse and her two daughters in a neighborhood that combines formal and informal commercial spaces, sport and recreation facilities, one of the most important Colombian soccer stadiums, and residential areas of apartment buildings and houses where hardworking families live.  Her family is no exception.

Marinella learned retail from her mother.  Twelve years ago, after having been an employee in a company, she started her own business venture once she managed to put together some savings for a variety of merchandise.  Her business grew little by little and she made adjustments with furniture and equipment to display her offerings.

Currently she has applied for two loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she has managed to increase her stock and her wholesale purchases for her business.  She has more cash and more customers.  This is exactly why she wants a Kiva loan, to respond to customer requests.  She wants to expand and strengthen her business more all the time.

With this loan she'll buy clothing, footwear, paper supplies, cosmetics, and other items.

Marinella's customers will be satisfied with her opportune response, so her Kiva loan is an investment with the potential for success.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita sells cosmetic products (make up, lipstick, lotions, and underwear) in her village. She collects orders from her costumers, and purchases the products in cash or credit in the market. She also sells the products door-to-door in her village. 

Juanita wishes for a loan of PHP 25,000 so she can purchase her products with cash in the market. With the loan, Juanita can buy stock to sell in her village. 

She hopes to minimize her travel expenses in marketing the products she sells.

loans.use: to pay cash to purchase products in the market.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedica a la carpintería desde hace catorce años, aprendió solo viendo y luego practico; antes solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una sierra de banco que sirve para pulir las piezas y el resto lo utilizara para comprar madera.  Al comprar la sierra, podrá elaborar los muebles más rápido, elevando la satisfacción de los clientes y fabricando más piezas para la venta; ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para la familia.  Su objetivo, es elaborar una galera más grande para instalar su taller de carpintería.
texts.en:
María is 63 years old. She is married and has one child. She has been working as a carpenter for the past fourteen years. She taught herself watching other people and then she started to practice. She was only a housewife before starting this work. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a table saw to sand pieces. With the remaining money she will buy wood. She will be able to make furniture more quickly when she buys the saw, raising her customers’ level of satisfaction, and she will be able to make more pieces for sale. This work is the only source of income for her family. Her aim is to build a bigger shed where she can set up her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy a table saw to sand pieces and to buy wood with the remaining money

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de fortalecer el negocio. Este le permitirá comprar refrescos, carne, quesillo, entre otros productos para la elaboración de las pupusas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer  la actividad  con el capital de trabajo  y con las ganancias aportar para la familia. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y lo que desea es aumentar sus ventas para crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is applying for a new loan because she needs to strengthen the business. 

It will allow her to buy soft drinks, meat, and cream cheese among other products to make 'pupusas' (stuffed tortillas). 

The last loan helped her to strengthen the business with working capital, and with the earnings provide for the family. Financial conditions have improved and Maria wants to increase her sales to grow the business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat and cream cheese, among other products.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa operates a tailoring business making garments for men, women, and school children. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailoring shops for customers. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  With a loan of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and needles. 

She so appreciates the last Kiva loan!

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and needles for her business.

loans.name: Crismelen

texts.en:
Crismelen is 27 years old. She is a married woman with one child, who is in school. Crismelen is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years.

Crismelen requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 54 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Tita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling prepaid mobile cards.

Tita requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like can goods, spices, soap, noodles, etc. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. Tita aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like can goods, spices, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Amule Clement

texts.en:
Amule Clement is a 40-year-old businessman who live in Yei. He is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 15. All of them go to school.

Amule Clement runs a general store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. Amule Clement is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase more body lotion and many other items. He has no other other sources of income besides this business.

In five years Amule Clement would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Amule Clement says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotions, books, pens, etc.

loans.name: Batmonh

texts.en:
Batmonh is 27 years old and lives with his wife in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Uurintuya, age 31, works as a waitress at a local cafeteria. Batmonth has been renting out the public shower in the Ger district area for the last three years. He is a plumber who takes care of any damage or problems as they arise.

Batmonh is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000MNT to purchase construction and insulation material to insulate and renovate his building to run his business smoothly and with no interruption. He is a hardworking, diligent and patient man.

loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation material to insulate and renovate his building to run his business smoothly with no sudden pause

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old, widowed, and has four children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Flora runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items.

Flora requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more soft-drinks, canned goods, bread, biscuits, and other groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as soft-drinks, canned goods, bread, biscuits, and other groceries

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a boneless dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Elisa has been in this business for 10 years now.

Elisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Yeni Yesenia

texts.es: Yeni de 38 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida en casa propia, ella es una mujer muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés desde hace 3 años tiene la panaderia en su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y atencion, Yeni solicita un credito para poder mejorar su panaderia y poder comprar productos para elaborar el pan frances como: harina, levadura, manteca, y mejorar sus hornos que muestra en la fotografia y todo lo necesario para poder producir mas . Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yeni is 38 years old and she lives with her life partner in her own house. She is a very responsible woman who is always on track to improve her financial stability. 

She works in her own bakery where she has been making French bread for three years. The bakery is in her place of residence and she has lots of customers because of her good work and kindness. 

Yeni is applying for a loan to be able to improve her bakery and buy products to make French bread such as: flour, yeast, butter, to improve her ovens which you can see in the photo, and everything she needs to be able to produce more. This improvement project for her bakery is very important for her since in this way she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread (flour, yeast, e.t.c)

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is an EarthSpark clean energy entrepreneur selling Lanp Enèji Pwòp solar light bulbs and TiPowa solar desk lamps with mobile phone charging on a rent-to-own basis. She lives in Les Cayes, the capital of the South Department of Haiti with her husband and child.
She currently has 32 customers renting out Lanp Enèji Pwòp and TiPowa and she has started to sell clean energy products with EarthSpark as clean energy entrepreneur. She sold out of her products so quickly that she has paid off her loan and is now coming back to us for another loan.
With the help of a Kiva loan last time, she was set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

loans.use: to pay for stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Bouboulou Group

texts.fr:
Mme  PINGUEDBAMBA est responsable du groupe  BOUBOULOU. Marié, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. Les 03 vont à l’école et elle à 04 personnes en charge.
Mme  est gérante de kiosque depuis 09ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  une cave de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter  04 caisses de bière, 02 caisses de sucreries et 02kg de viande pour la soupe.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Mme ambitionne ouvrir d’autres kiosques et aider la famille pour éventuel problème.
texts.en:
Ms. PINGUEDBAMBA is the official of the group BOUBOULOU. She is the married mother of three children. The oldest is 15 years old, and the youngest is 7. The three go to school, and she has four persons to support. 

Ms. PINGUEDBAMBA has been the manager of a stand for nine years. She gets her supplies from a storehouse in her district. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase 5 cases of beer, 2 cases of soft drinks, and 2 kg of meat for soup. 

She wants to use her profits to help her children's schooling. Her ambition is to open other stands and to help out her family with possible problems.

loans.use: to purchase beer, soft drinks, and meat for making soup

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Ana de 42 años de edad vive con sus dos hijos de 20 y 18 años quienes son jornaleros(trabajan en la agricultura), ella es empleada domestica en una casa los tres trabajan cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que les pagan han podido salir adelante y solventar los gastos que se les presantan, pero Doña Ana esta solictando un credito para poder construir un muro en su casa ya que se encuentra un barranco atras de su casa que es lo muestra en la fotografia y no se siente segura en su hogar, ella solicita ese credito para darle una mejor seguridad a sus hijos ya que con lo que ganan no les alcanza para poder contruir su casa.
texts.en:
42-year-old Ana lives with her two sons aged 20 and 18 years who are labourers (they work in agriculture). She is a domestic worker in a house. The three of them work near their home. 

With their pay they have been able to move forward and cover the costs they face, but Ana is applying for a loan to be able to build a wall for her house. This is because there is a steep slope behind their house, which is what you can see in the photograph, and she does not feel safe in her home. She is applying for this loan to give her children more safety as what they earn doesn't cover the cost of building their house.

loans.use: to build a wall for her house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta vive en Guayaquil. Empezó vendiendo alitas y chuzos luego por su salud  empezó a vender cosméticos a sus amistades y con esto saca adelante a su familia.

Trabaja sola abre a las 8h00 y cierra a las 18h00. Vende cosméticos como perfumes de hombre y mujer cremas entre otras cosas. Su dificultad es cuando recae con su enfermedad se le dificulta vender los productos ya que es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida). Si es casada su esposo es maestro electricista, tiene un hijo de 10 años y estudia en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo va a comprar cosméticos y articulos escolares. Su sueño es disfrutar con su familia una buena calidad de vida, tener su casa propia y un vehículo para movilizarme y distribuir sus cosméticos.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil.  She started out selling meat skewers, and later, because of her health, she started selling cosmetics to her friends.  This is how she gets ahead with her family.

She works alone from 8am until 6pm.  She sells products such as perfumes for men and women, creams, and other items.  Her difficulty is that when her illness recurs, it makes it difficult for her to sell her products (she is a patient who is living with HIV/AIDS).  She is married, and her husband is a master electrician.  They have a 10 year-old child who attends public school.

With this loan, she will buy cosmetics and school supplies.  Her dreams include: enjoying her family and a good quality of life, having her own home, and having a vehicle to get around and distribute her cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk thread to make hammocks

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Norma del Carmen vive en la cuidad de managua trabaja comercializando productos perecederos en un mercado de l capital , tiene tres hijos los cuales están en edad escolar. el día de trabajo empieza  a las 5 de la mañana.

esta solicitando el  crédito para invertirlo en la compra de productos que oferta a su clienta, tales como:  tamarindo ,ayote, yuca, quequisque. 

Doña Norma esta muy agradecida con kiva y ceprodel por que gracias a los créditos que se le han otorgado ha mantenido su negocio y esto le ha ayudado a incrementar  sus ganancia para  mantener los  estudios a sus hijo y darles todas las condiciones necesaria a su familia.
texts.en: Norma del Carmen lives in the city of Managua. She works selling perishable goods in a market in the capital. She has three school-aged children. Her work day begins at 5 in the morning. She is asking for a loan to buy products to sell to her customers, such as tamarinds, squash, yucca, and quequisque. Norma is very grateful to Kive and Ceprodel because thanks to the loans they have given her, she has supported her business and this has helped her to increase her earnings to keep her children in school and give her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy tamarinds, squash, yucca, and quequisque.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Janeth trabaja como decente en un colegio de primaria, su nivel de  educación es  técnico medio en educación, vive en casa propia ocupando 2  habitaciones en un acabado de ladrillo  y piso de cemento en la zona Las Muñecas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Janeth trabaja 8 horas al día, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua, educación de sus cuatro hijos y otros.

El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su baño; comprará material de construcción como ser cemento, estuco, pintura.

El sueño de Janeth es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios superiores.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO y la segunda con Kiva.
texts.en:
Janeth works as a teacher in an elementary school. She has a diploma in education. She lives in her own home, occupying two rooms built from brick with a cement floor in the Las Muñecas area in the city of La Paz.
Janeth works eight hours a day to cover the costs of food, light, water, the education of her four children, and other expenses. She needs the loan to remodel her bathroom. She will buy construction materials like cement, plaster, and paint. Janeth's dream is for her children to finish their higher education. This is her second loan with IMPRO and her second from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement, plaster, and paint, in order to remodel her bathroom.

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es: Domingo Antonio de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, sus dos hijos y tres nietos los cuales ayudan en la cosecha, es agricultor desde hace mas de 25 años siembra frijol y maiz los cuales le han dado mucha experiencia en los cultivos, con la venta de sus cosechas ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. E Señor Domingo quiere aumentar la producción y poder contratar a otras personas para que le ayuden en sus cosechas y en los nuevos planes que el tiene para su agricultura como la cria de pollos asi como muestra la fotografia, pero no posee de suficiente capital para poder realizarlo por eso se decidió a solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, abono, algunas herramientas de trabajo etc. Asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Domingo Antonio, 50, lives in his own house with his wife, two children, and three grandchildren, who help him with the harvest. He is a farmer, and for more than 25 years, he has planted beans and corn, which has given him a lot of experience with these crops. He has been able to help his family advance with the sales from his harvests. Domingo wants to increase his production and hire other people to help him with the harvests. He also has new plans for his farm, like raising chickens, as the photo shows. But he doesn't have enough capital to be able to do it. So he decided to apply for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, manure, some work tools, etc. He is confident he will be able to pay back the loan and give his family what they need with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay workers.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en: Gil is engaged in the farming business. He plants and harvests rice for sale. He generates PHP 30,000 during harvest season. Gil uses his income for the education of his children. At present, Gil is requesting a loan of PHP 45,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain his business. In the future, Gil hopes to start another business aside from his farming business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lany

texts.en: Lany is a 43-year-old mother who runs a small variety store in her community to help her husband earn income. She aims to make her business profitable in order to generate sufficient income to support the education of her four children and satisfy their necessities. In this regard, she plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P15,000 to buy soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, laundry soaps, shampoo, beverages, and seasonings to sell. She is hoping that someday she will be able to improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, canned goods, laundry soaps, shampoo, beverages, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 34 years old, and her husband is an overseas Filipino worker (OFW) in Saudi Arabia. They have one child. She has a business selling some bags of rice in their village. In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 10,000 a month. She would like a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase bags of rice to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it properly and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Morayma

texts.es: Morayma, de 24 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su familia. El trabajo de Morayma consiste en la confección y refacción de diferentes prendas de vestir ya sea de damas, caballeros y niños. Plasma en cada uno de las prendas que realiza lo mejor de su creatividad poniendo mucho empeño en la ejecución de los detalles, todo ese perfeccionismo se refleja en la satisfacción que muestran sus clientes al recibir una prenda de calidad. Lleva 1 año en este negocio y comparte esta actividad con su madre quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para realizar un buen trabajo.Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que labora con la asesoría de su madre, por otra parte, asegura que sus clientes son selectos y eso le permite recibir buenos pagos por cada prenda que realiza, espera seguir progresando en esta actividad ya que tiene muchas expectativas a futuro.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 para la compra de colgadores de ropa, hilos de colores, agujas y algunas telas especiales para confeccionar vestidos y blusas.
texts.en:
Morayma is 24 years old. She is married and has one son. She lives in her parents' house together with her family.  Morayma's work consists of sewing and altering various garments for women, men and children. 

Each of the items she create captures her creativity, and she puts a lot of effort into the details. This perfectionism is reflected in the satisfaction of her customers when they receive a quality garment.

She has had this business for 1 year and shares this activity with her mother who taught her all she needs to know to carry out good work.

The thing she likes about her work is that she is able to work with the help of her mother. She makes sure that her customers are well-chosen so that she can receive a good income on each item of clothing she makes. 

Morayma hopes to continue moving forward with this business as she has many hopes for the future. She is asking for a loan of s./ 1500 to buy clothes-hangers, coloured thread, needles and some special fabric to sew.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing such as fabrics, thread, and elastics.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es:
Don Eduardo un humilde señor, de 51 años de edad, originario de Managua, soltero, padre de 2 hijos de 27 y 28 años, respectivamente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería, del que es propietario hace mas  de 6 años. Solo logro finalizar su sexto grado de primaria.
Eduardo comenzó trabajando desde muy joven, en un taller de mecánica, pero luego miro que le pagaban muy  poco y decidió renunciar, luego con el tiempo el decide emprender su propio negocio, como es su pulpería, ya que el necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y generar ingresos por si solo, el dice que le va muy bien en su negocio, porque le genera ganancias a diario, cuenta con clientes fijos,  recibe otros ingresos como es la  remesa  que le envía su hermano y  el dinero que le dan del alquiler de los cuartos.
