El esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar gaseosa, arroz, azúcar, galletas, frijoles y  productos enlatados como atún, sardinas y a la misma vez comprar 3 laminas de zinc, con el objetivo de comprar toda la mercadería que aun  no tiene en inventario, ya que de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a humble man, 51 years old, originally from Managua, single, father of 2 children who are 27 and 28 years old, respectively, and works in the grocery store business being an owner for more than 6 years. He only finished the 6th grade of primary school.

Eduard began working when he was very young, in a mechanics workshop, but later he saw that they paid him very little so he decided to quit, eventually deciding to start his own business, his grocery store, because he needed a way to survive and generate income for himself. He says that he is doing well in his business, because he is earning income daily, has regular customers, receives other income such as the remittance that his brother sends and the money that they give him for room rentals.

He is asking for funding to buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, cookies, beans, and canned food such as tuna, sardines and also to buy 3 sheets of zinc. He has the goal of buying all the merchandise that is not in inventory so that he can increase sales and obtain better profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, sugar, cookies, beans and canned products such as tuna, and sardines and also to buy 3 sheets of zinc

loans.name: Jose Astul

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito porque necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir trabajando en el cultivo. Este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas para lograr iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol.
El préstamo anterior adquirió lo necesario de materiales agrícolas para llevar acabo la siembra. Las condiciones de vida han mejorado, ya que ha podido aportar para ayudarles a sus hijos con los gastos del estudio.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan because he needs more working capital in order to continue working in farming. This will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides in order to begin planting corn and beans.

He bought the necessary agricultural supplies with his previous loan in order to finish the planting. His living conditions have improved, as he has been able to contribute towards helping his children with school expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito, tiene 35 años de edad , esta casado y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia y siempre va en busca del progreso y de mejorar su situación económica para consolidar su futuro.Tito se dedica al transporte público de personas por la ciudad. Trabaja todos los días por horas programadas. Recorre todas las calles de la ciudad en busca de pasajeros que requieran ser trasladados a algún lugar específico y el se encarga de que lleguen a su destino sin ningún inconveniente y con total seguridad. Tiene un mototaxi propio desde hace 8 años pero trabaja en este rubro por más de 20 años. Ocasionalmente trabaja en la compra y venta de productos agropecuarios en el puerto de la ciudad y considera esta actividad muy rentable, pero que requiere de una buena inversión.Es por eso que desea desarrollar esta nueva actividad sin descuidar su labor como mototaxista para mejorar sus ingresos económicos por el bien de su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 3800 soles para reparar su mototaxi y cambiarle el tapizado , además comprará productos agropecuarios para continuar con su venta .
texts.en:
Tito is 35 years old, married, and has three children (ages 15, 12, and 3 respectively). He lives in his own house with his entire family, so he is always looking for ways to make progress and improve his financial situation in order to secure their future. Tito is employed in the public transportation sector, taking people to areas throughout the city. He works every day at designated hours. Tito travels down all of the streets within the city in search of passengers in need of a ride to specified places. He takes his passengers to their destination without any problem and provides them with complete safety.

Tito has operated his own motorcycle taxi for eight years, but he has been doing this type of work for more than 20 years. Occasionally he buys and sells agricultural products at the city port, an activity that he considers to be very profitable but it requires a significant investment. For this reason, he wants to develop his new business without neglecting his work as a motorcycle taxi driver. This will improve his income for the benefit of his family.

Tito is taking this opportunity to request 3,800 PEN so that he can repair his motorcycle taxi and replace the upholstery. He will also buy agricultural products so that he can continue selling them.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle taxi, replace the upholstery, and buy agricultural products that he can sell.

loans.name: Camila Isabel

texts.es:
Camila tiene 36 años, tiene estudios primarios y aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven. Está casada con Washington de 37 años con quien tiene 4 hijos a quienes esperan darle la educación que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de terminar y por lo que se encuentran estudiando en una escuela pública cerca de su residencia. Camila vive con su esposa e hijos  en la Parroquia Chigüilpe a 15 minutos del centro de Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Esta parroquia tiene varias viviendas de cemento y mixtas de madera con cemento. Tiene un río que es muy visitado y en donde los turistas y habitantes practican varios deportes y además tienen la oportunidad de conocer una cultura tsáchila que suele contar sus leyendas a los visitantes en medio de una fogata y camping. Santo Domingo que es la tercera ciudad más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. 
Camila vio la necesidad de aportar en su familia con los ingresos ya que el trabajo de su esposo como maestro enderezador no alcanzaba para la manutención de su hogar, principalmente porque sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan cubrir gastos mayores de educación, vestimenta y otros. Es por esto que Camila desde hace 5 años emprendió con la actividad de venta de cosméticos y joyas lo cual le da cierto porcentaje de ganancia por sus ventas y también obtiene premios que los usa en su hogar. Aprendió de una amiga quien la animó a realizar esta actividad y ahora le dedica al menos 8 horas. Esta madre esforzada ahora quiere emprender con la venta de ropa casual para lo cual requiere un préstamo con el cual comprará mercadería al por mayor en un almacén donde ofrecen atractivos descuentos y así ella pueda visitar a sus clientes y ofrecerles este nuevo producto para que sus utilidades mejoren y así el estilo de vida de su hogar mejore. Camila agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la excelencia en servicio que han tenido con ella al brindarle apoyo para conseguir sus sueños, ella está muy satisfecha por la agilidad, confianza, servicios y asesoría de su ejecutivo que le han permitido tener esperanza en su futuro. Piensa que el producto Kiva es muy acertado para personas como ella que buscan oportunidad de obtener capital para lograr sus sueños.
texts.en:
Camila is 36 years old. She has a primary school education, and she learned to work when she was very young. She is married to Washington, age 37, and they have 4 children together, whom they hope to give the education they themselves did not have the opportunity to complete. The children are attending a public school near their home. Camila lives with her husband and children in the Chigüilpe Parish, 15 minutes from the center of Santo Domingo, capital of the Province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. This is a place with very active commerce, since it has become a terrestrial port of exchange between Ecuador's coastal and mountain regions. This parish has some homes made of cement and some made of both wood and cement. It has a river which is popular with visitors, where tourists and local inhabitants practice various sports, and they also have the opportunity to get to know the Tsáchila culture, since the people tend to tell their legends to visitors around a campfire, on camping trips. Santo Domingo, which has the third largest population in the region, also contributes with activities such as agriculture, ranching, fishing and manufacturing. 

Camila saw the need to provide income within her family, since her husband's work as a teaching director was not sufficient to support their household, mainly because their children are growing and they need to cover higher costs for education, clothing, etc. For this reason, five years ago Camila began selling cosmetics and jewelry, which gave her a certain percentage of profit on her sales, and she also obtained prizes which she uses in her home. She learned from a friend who encouraged her to do this work, and now she dedicates at least 8 hours to it. This hard-working mother now wants to start selling casual clothing, for which purpose she needs a loan with which she will buy merchandise on a wholesale basis in a warehouse where they offer attractive discounts. Thus she will be able to visit her customers and offer them this new product. In this way, her profits will increase and her household's standard of living will improve. Camila is grateful to the Alternativa Foundation for the excellent service they have provided to her in giving her support to achieve her dreams. She is very satisfied with the flexibility, confidence, services and advising of her executive committee, which has allowed her to have hope for her future. She believes that the Kiva product is very appropriate for people like her who are looking for the opportunity to obtain capital to achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Lorena es casada, de 36 años de edad y de escolaridad 3 años secundaria, tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a vender comida y tortillas, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia. También cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamos que lo utilizará para comprar Insumos para poder preparar comida y tortillas para vender, en el futuro que se acerca quiere tener un restaurante; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio como: venta de ropa, cosmeticos y tambien comida y tortillas. 

En la fotografía no aparecen 3 integrantes porque no pudieron asistir cuando se tomo la foto.
texts.en: Silvia Lorena, 36, is married. She completed three years of secondary school. She has six children, three of whom are studying. She works selling food and tortillas. She started this business with a little money, and now she has eight years of experience. She also has the support of her husband, who is a businessman. She organized a group and applied for a loan that she will use to buy ingredients to make food and tortillas to sell. In the near future, she wants to have a restaurant. The other group members have businesses such as selling clothes, cosmetics, and food and tortillas. Three of the members are not in the photograph because they could not be there when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es:
Kelly  a sus 21 años de edad se proyecta como una gran empresaria. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a la confección y corte de ropa femenina. Asegura que desde niña su gran pasión siempre ha sido la moda, por lo cual ingresó a la universidad a estudiar diseño. 
Con el propósito de generar los ingresos para pagar su carrera, inició confeccionando prendas para amigos y familiares, y gracias a su buen trabajo hoy no sólo cuenta con ellos como clientes, si no que muchos de los almacenes del sector también solicitan de sus prendas. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito a fin de comprar materia prima (telas) para entregar los pedidos realizados.
Su mayor sueño es registrar su propia marca y abrir su propia tienda de ropas y accesorios para damas. Espera poderse graduar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Kelly is 21 years old and sees herself as a successful entrepreneur. For the past year, she has been sewing and designing women’s clothing. Kelly says that she has always been deeply passionate about fashion since she was a girl. She enrolled at the university in order to study design.

Kelly started making outfits for friends and relatives with the intent of generating income to help pay for her degree. Thanks to her good work, not only are they her customers, but she also has several local stores that are requesting her designs. For this reason, Kelly is requesting a loan for buying fabrics so that she can deliver her pending orders.

Her greatest wish is to register her own brand and open a women’s clothing and accessories store. She also expects to graduate and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Cabriquense Group

texts.es:
La señora Dina Maribel es de estado civil casada, cuenta actualmente con 24 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación secundaria, tiene 1 hijo pequeño; ella se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, especificamente a pollos, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le concedio su esposo y hasta la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja de mecánico.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de 4 docenas de pollos para engorde y concentrado para las mismas. con el paso del tiempo quiere tener una granja grande y exitosa, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de pollos, venta de verduras, venta de ropa típica y a tejer.

Una de las integrantes del grupo no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto, es por esa razon que ahi no figura.
texts.en:
Dina Maribel is 24 years old.  She is married and has a young child.  She has completed six years of secondary school.  She is engaged in breeding poultry, particularly chickens.  She started this business with a little capital that her husband gave her.  She has three years of experience to date and also has the support of her husband, who works as a mechanic.  

She organized a group so she could request a loan that will allow her to purchase four dozen chickens to fatten as well as purchase concentrated feed for them.  With time, she wants to have a large, successful farm.  The rest of the group members are engaged in raising chickens, selling vegetables, selling traditional clothing, and weaving.  One of the group members could not attend the photo session, and this is the reason she does not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase for breeding.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a farmer living in Masipi with his wife and children. He plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. He usually makes about 10,000 PHP each harvest twice a year, which goes for food, home expenses, school fees and money for the farm. He would like to improve his harvests but doesn’t have enough money to make those improvements.

Jimmy is now asking for a loan of 45,000 PHP through ASKI to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farm. He hopes to keep bettering his farming practices and continue making good money for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 57 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos adultos y habita al suroccidente de la ciudad con su esposo. Desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, se dedica a su negocio de preparación y venta de gelatinas, refrescos y helados, con una frecuencia semanal; ella posee una clientela construida a los largo de sus 16 años de experiencia y es muy reconocida en su barrio y en los sectores aledaños al lugar donde habita. Su meta mas adelante es tener las instalaciones locativas adecuadas a su tipo de negocio y para eso debe aumentar su cobertura, por eso para lograrlo, requiere capital fresco que le permita aumentar su producción. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, séptimo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha incrementado sus ventas fortaleciendo su oferta. Con este nuevo financiamiento Luz Marina comprará  materias primas, gelatinas, bolis y helados, así como leche condensada entre otros insumos, para hacer una producción dirigida a nuevas plazas cercanas y hacer de esta inversión todo un éxito. .
texts.en: Luz Marina is 57 years old. She is the mother of 4 adult children and she lives in the south western part of the city with her husband. From 8 in the morning until 6 at night she works at her business making and selling gelatin, drinks, and ice cream that she sells weekly. She has customers she has gained over her 16 years experience and she is very well known in her neighborhood and in the areas nearby where she lives. Her goal for the future is to have a locale set up for this type of business and to do that she has to increase her coverage. To do that , she needs fresh capital that will allow her to increase her production. That is why she has turned to to a Kiva loan, the seventh loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This organization has increased her sales, fortifying her supplies. With this new loan, Luz Marina will buy ingredients, gelatins, ice pops and ice cream, condensed mill, and more to produce for nearby plazas and make this investment a total success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, gelatin, ice pops, and ice cream.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María,  solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita fortalecer el negocio de venta de comida. Este le permitirá comprar pollo, carne, quesillo, harina, refrescos, entre otros productos para seguir realizando pupusas y comida. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a optimizar el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado aportar para su familia. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que ha podido mantener el negocio y ayudar a la familia con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María's requesting another loan because she needs to strengthen her business selling food.  This will allow her to buy chicken, meat, cheese, flour, soft drinks, and other products to continue making "pupusas" [stuffed tortillas] and food.

The previous loan helped her make the most of her business and with the profits she has managed to provide for her family.  Her financial condition has improved because she has been able to support the business and help her family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, cheese, flour, soft drinks, and other products

loans.name: Sandra Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Sandra, originaria de Diriamba, pero actualmente viven en Managua, una humilde comerciante, de 61 años de edad, casada, madre de 7 hijos, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada, de la que es propietaria hace mas de 30 años.
Inicio en el ámbito del comercio,  vendiendo  con su mama, pailas, cuchara, panas, zapatos de forma ambulante, es asi como ella se ganaban la vida, luego con el tiempo ella decide independizarse y seguir con la misma actividad, ya que ella necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir y poder  generar ingresos por si misma, la cual decidió vender zapatos, ropa, se siente muy bien porque este negocio le genera ganancias a diario, cuenta con el apoyo de todos sus hijos.
Sus expectativas es poder ampliar su negocio con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ingresos. Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar, ropa para niño, adultos, zapatos, cremas, vanidad, perfumes, etc.
texts.en:
Sandra, is from Diriamba, but right now she lives in Managua. She is a humble merchant who is 61, married and the mother of 7 children. She sells varied merchandise, a business she has had for more than 30 years.

She started as a merchant selling pails, spoons, panas, and shoes as a street vendor with  her mother. That is how they used to earn their living. Later, as time passed, she decided to go off on her own and keep doing the same activity because she needed to support herself and generate some income. She decided to sell shoes and clothes. She feels good because this business generates daily earnings and she has the support of all of her children.

She hopes to be able to expand her business with the purpose of increasing her sales to make more income. She needs the loan to buy children's and adult's clothing, shoes, lotions, makeup, perfume, etc.

loans.use: to buy children's and adult's clothing, shoes, lotions, makeup, perfume.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalina is 59 years old, married. She lives with her husband and children in Lanna. 

Five years ago, Rosalina started a grocery business where she sells household products, such as basic grains, meats, bread, medicines, donuts, soft drinks, and toiletries. She has decided to request a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 so that she can restock her store with basic grains, meats, dairy products, and other groceries in order to offer a wider and better variety of products. With this investment, she hopes to increase her sales and her income. She also expects to improve her quality of life so that she can help her children graduate.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, dairy products, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 56 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Cresencia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cresencia has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Claudia quien con su credikiva logró comprar mercancias como perfumes, colonias, cremas y articulos de miscelanea, que le permitieron diversificar con nueva  gama de productos, incrmentar sus ventas y aumentar sus utilidades. Claudia umentando sus utilidaes ayuda mas a su esposo a finaciar los gastos del hogar . Ella dice a sus financiadores: " Gracias por el dinero que me prestaron porque con él pude hacer crecer mi negocio y necesito aun mas de su apoyo para seguir adelante " En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará un congelador para continuar adicionando productos alimenticios y comprará mercancia como articulos de uso femenino, bisutería, colonias, cremas, etc.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Claudia who, with her Kiva loan, was able to purchase merchandise such as perfumes, colognes, lotions, and miscellaneous items, allowing her to diversify her product range, increase her sales and profits. With increased profits Claudia is able to help her husband more with the costs of the household. Claudia tells her funders: "Thank you for the funds that you have loaned me as with it I was able to grow my business and now I need still more help to keep going." Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will purchase a freezer so she can continue adding food products and she will purchase merchandise such as feminine products, jewelry, colognes, creams, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer so she can continue adding food products and to purchase merchandise such as feminine products, jewelry, colognes, creams, and other items.

loans.name: Clara Elena

texts.es:
Clara de 59 años de edad es madre de tres hijos, por los cuales ha luchado incansablemente para ofrecerles una mejor condición  de vida. Su esposo falleció hace algún tiempo por lo cual debió asumir las responsabilidades del hogar. Desde su juventud, aprendió el oficio de la confección por lo cual lo perfeccionó con la práctica y convirtió la actividad en su fuente de ingresos. Con su pequeño taller ubicado en la sala de su casa esta mujer consigue el pan de cada día y los recursos para la educación de su hijo menor. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos, Clara decidió montar de manera alternativa una miscelánea para complementar labor. Hoy siente gran satisfacción con los resultados, pues considera que su calidad de vida ha mejorado. 
Con el propósito de seguir creciendo en el mercado, se encuentra solicitando un crédito  para la compra de mercancía y reformas locativas en la sala de su vivienda en donde tiene ubicada la papelería y el taller de confección.
texts.en:
Clara is 59 years old. She is the mother of three children. She has fought tirelessly to offer them a better quality of life. Her husband died some time ago and she has to take over responsibility for the home. In her youth, she learned how to sew and she perfected it with practice and made it into her source of income. With her little workshop located in her living room, this woman gets the daily bread and the resources for her younger son's education. In order to improve her income, Clara decided to also open a variety store to add to her work. Today she is very satisfied with the results because she thinks her quality of life has improved. 
 
With the purpose of growing in the market, she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise and do some improvements on the living room of her house where she has the paper goods store and the sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy different items for her variety store and to make some improvements on the locale.

loans.name: Ma. Lisa

texts.en:
Ma. Lisa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a boneless dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish for her business.

Ma. Lisa has been in this business for 4 years. Ma. Lisa earns additional income from hog raising.

Ma. Lisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish for her business

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas.
É comerciante, vende roupas diversas.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (mantas, calças, sapatos, juvês, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio construindo um estabelecimento comercial e adquirir uma viatura para fins comerciais, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para investir mais no seu negócio e a dificuldade de transporte de mercadoria.
texts.en:
Fernando is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a house that he owns and he supports his mother by sending money to help her afford her expenses.
He's a merchant who sells various types of clothing. With the current loan he intends to purchase products (shawls, trousers, shoes and other garments) in order to stock up with merchandise.
His wish for the future is to expand his business by building a store and acquiring a vehicle for commercial purposes. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge he faces is not having enough funds to invest more in his business. Also, it's difficult to transport the merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (shawls, trousers, shoes and other garments).

loans.name: Evigénia

texts.pt:
Casada e não tem filhos, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É comerciante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de mesas e cadeiras. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar cadeiras e mesas na RSA para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio adquirindo uma viatura para transporte de mercadoria, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos disponíveis para realizar todos seus projectos
texts.en:
Evigénia is married and doesn't have any children. She lives in a house that she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
She's a merchant who owns her own business selling chairs and tables. With the current loan she intends to purchase chairs and tables in South Africa in order to stock up with merchandise.
Her wish for the future is to expand her business by acquiring a vehicle to transport her merchandise. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is not having enough funds to accomplish all her projects.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables in South Africa in order to stock up with merchandise.

loans.name: Jessica Nohemy

texts.es:
Jessica, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de incrementar las ventas. Este le permitirá comprar anillos, pulseras, gargantias,  cadenas, perfumes, entre otros productos. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a invertir en el negocio, asimismo aumentaron los ingresos lo que le permitió darse una mejor estabilidad de vida. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y aumento la clientela.
texts.en:
Jessica is requesting a new loan because she needs to increase her sales. This will allow her to buy rings, bracelets, necklaces, chains, as well as perfumes and other products.

Her previous loan helped her to invest in her business. As a result, she increased her earnings and experienced greater stability in her life. Her financial condition improved and she increased her clientele.

loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, necklaces, chains, as well as perfumes and other products.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en: Efren is applying for a new loan because he needs to invest more money in the production of basic foods. This will allow him to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticide, herbicide, and insecticide, among other items. With his previous loan, his income increased, and he invested it in household expenses. His economic condition improved, thanks to the loan that Kiva granted him.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, pesticide, herbicide, and insecticide, among other items.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos, todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como empregada domestica.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, blocos, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua residência. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa, concluir o seu curso de máquinas marítimas e fazer crescer ao seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Felicia is single and has two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a house that she owns and she doesn't support anyone else.
She works as a housekeeper. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, bricks, beams, etc.) in order to continue building her house.
Felicia's wish for the future is to finish building her house, complete her studies in maritime machinery and expand her business. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, sand, bricks, beams, etc.) in order to continue building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La clienta  vive en Guayaquil. Empezó hace algunos  años atrás en la tienda de poco a poco la ha ido surtiendo con esto a podido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella trabaja sola en la tienda abre a las 8h00 y cierra a las 23h00.

Su dificultad en el negocio es que en el sector donde ella esta hay mucha delincuencia y también su salud ya q hay veces que no puede trabajar normalmente YA QUE ES PVVS (paciente viviendo con vih sida). No está casada, tiene un hijo de 1 año 8 meses. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar arroz, azucar, bebidas, enlatdos. Su sueño es estar junto a su familia tener una casa propia un vehículo y una tienda bien surtida para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Guayaquil and manages a store she opened a few years ago. She gradually was able to stock her business and has been able to help her family get ahead. The borrower works alone in her store, which opens at 8:00 A.M. and closes at 11:00 P.M.

Her difficulty with her business is that her neighborhood experiences a lot of crime. She must also deal with her health, since she is not able to work on a normal basis. The borrower is a patient who lives with HIV/AIDS. She is not married and has a child who is one year and eight months old.

With this loan, the borrower will purchase rice, sugar, beverages, and canned goods. Her dream is to live with her family in a house of her own. She would also like to acquire a vehicle and have a well-stocked store so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beverages, and canned goods.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Don Teodoro de 45 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la comercializacion de hamacas, las comercializa de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia de las 8:00 de la mañana a las 3:00 de la tarde, asi como se muestra en la fotografia, y luego va a trabajar a una panaderia. Con las ganancias que logra obtener de sus ventas y el pago que resive en la panaderia ha podido salir adelante con su familia, vive con sus esposa quien es comerciante en el mercado y su hijo. Don Teodoro esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para poder comercializarla ya que con lo que el gana no le alcanza para hacer una nueva inversion y asi el podra tener mejores ganancias y seguir solventando los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Teodoro is 45 years old and has been selling hammocks for several years. He sells his products near his home as a street vendor from 8:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M., as shown in the photograph. Afterwards, he works at a bakery.

With the profits he generates from his sales and the pay he receives from the bakery, Teodoro has been able to help his family get ahead. He lives with his wife, who is a merchant, and their child. Don Teodoro is requesting a loan so that he can buy more merchandise to sell since he does not have enough to make a new investment. As a result, he will generate more income and be able to continue providing for the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stationary and a coverstich sewing machine.

loans.name: Martha Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Martha  de 53 años de edad es originaria de Jinotega, pero hace 7 años que viven en Managua,  ella a  pesar de su larga edad es una señora muy trabajadora, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su actividad por iniciativa propia hace 47 años ya que quería ser una persona independiente,  ya que ella comenzó vendiendo ropa por encargo y cosméticos  de forma ambulantes,  en los barrios aledaños en donde habita su hijos la apoya con la pulpería, sus productos los comercializa en su casa de habitación. Cuenta con otros ingresos dinero que le da su esposo, hoy en día quiere invertir en su pulpería para poder ofrecer a sus clientes productos variados y obtener mejores ingresos.
Realiza el crédito para comprar granos básicos, arroz, huevo, aceite, azúcar, jugos, gaseosa, galletas etc. Todos los insumos  necesarios para su pulpería, ella estima que este crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá surtir su negocio para mayor atracción de clientes, incrementaran sus ventas generando a la vez mejores ingresos, sus planes futuros es diversificar su negocio para ser una mejor comerciante.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha, 53 years old, is a native of Jinotega, however she has been living in Managua for seven years. Despite being older, she is a very hardworking lady, a trader who runs a small store. She started her business on her own initiative 47 years ago because she wanted to be independent. She began by selling clothes on order and cosmetics by going door to door in neighborhoods adjoining where she lives. Her children help sell products in her store, which is located in her home. She also relies on funds that her husband gives her.

Nowadays she wants to invest in her store so that she can offer her customers more products and earn more income. She has taken out a loan to purchase basic grains, rice, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, juice, soft drinks, cookies, etc. and all other supplies necessary for her store. She estimates that this loan will help because she will be able to stock her business to attract more customers. This will increase her sales and generate a higher income. Her future plans are to diversity her business in order to become a better 
businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, rice, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, juice, soft drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en: Kristina is 37 years old.  She is married and she has one child.  She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about  how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan.  She is applying for her second loan of $ 1.000.  She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as noodles, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, bread and cigarettes. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite,bread and cigarettes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mattresses, beds and other items.

loans.name: Singnere Group

texts.fr:
Mme  AÏSSATOU représente le groupe  SINGNERE. Sur la photo, c'est la trésorière qui a levé la main. AÏSSATOU est arrêter en tee shirt blanc et a un pagne suspendu sur son épaule. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 01 va à l’école.
AÏSSATOU vend des gâteaux depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne à pissy. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter  01sac de farine de blé et 01bidon d’huile de 20l pour la préparation des gâteaux.
Elle veut aider à la scolarisation des enfants avec ses bénéfices. AÏSSATOU ambitionne ouvrir un magasin de stockage pour la farine et l’huile  et aider à construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou represents the Singnere group. On the photo, the person raising her hand is the treasurer. Aissatou is in the back wearing a white t-shirt with a piece of cloth on her shoulder. She is married and has four children. The eldest is 20 years old, and the yongers one year old. One of her children attends school.

Aissatou has been selling cakes for four years. She stocks up in Pissy. Her customers are both men and women. She would like to buy one bag of wheat flour and one 20-l [5-gallon] jug of vegetable oil to prepare her cakes. She would like to contribute to her [child’s] education thanks to her revenues. Aissatou’s goal is to open a warehouse for flour and oil and help pay for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy one bag of wheat flour and one 20-l [5-gallon] jug of oil for making cakes.

loans.name: Santoshi Maa Group

texts.en: In the year 2011, four women from Titilagarh town of Balangir district in Odisha, India, formed a group named Santoshi Maa to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Binodini, a headstrong and confident lady, is one of them. She hails from a poor family living below the poverty line. The lady standing on the extreme left in the photo raising her hand is Binodini. She is 27 years old and lives with her husband; two sons, ages 12 and 10 years old; and her daughter, age 16. All her children are continuing their studies. Binodini has been running a tiffin stall for the last 10 years with the hand-holding support of her husband. She also has a grinding machine in her house. Apart from this, her husband takes outdoor orders for making sweets items for marriage parties and social functions. Binodini makes a monthly income of 5,000 Indian rupees (INR) from the above business. With this income, she is hardly able to manage her household and the educational expenses of her children. So, she wants to expand her business by taking out a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. With the present loan, Binodini wants to purchase more stock of oil, dough, sugar, etc. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she has to replenish her stock frequently. She also wants to use a portion of the loan to repair her tiffin stall. Binodini hopes to save enough to build a good house of her own as her present house is a small hut. The other three members of the group are Ranju, Mamata and Sailabala who are running a barber shop, tiffin stall and tiffin push cart respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing of oil, dough, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lona Monday

texts.en: Lona Monday is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 12. All of her children go to school. Lona runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. Lona heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is requesting a loan of SSP3,500 to purchase more items, such as soap, feminine products, books, etc., for her store. She has no other source of income. In five years Lona would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market. Lona says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as soap, feminine products, books, etc., for her store.

loans.name: Hamidou Ousmane

texts.fr:
Né en Octobre 1988 à Zégoua (frontière Mali-Côte d’Ivoire), Monsieur  Hamidou Ousmane  est un célibataire résidant à Sanoubougou II dans une famille traditionnelle  dans la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Hamidou Ousmane n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, alors il s’est vite initié aux activités d’achat et de vente des téléphones portables, de leurs accessoires (façade, baraterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) et bien d’autres articles divers, depuis maintenant 10 ans. Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique à la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et surtout de transporteurs. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux années avec laquelle il a déjà bénéficié de six crédits qui ont tous été correctement remboursés. Ainsi, Il sollicite ce septième crédit pour acheter, à Bamako  65 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 15 cartons de façade, une quinzaine de chargeurs, 30 paquets de carte mémoire, 30 cartons de batterie, 20 douzaines d’écouteur de différentes sortes, une dizaine de montres différentes et des ceintures. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 180 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Hamidou Ousmane was born in October 1988 in Zégoua (on the border between Ivory Coast and Mali). He is single, lives in a traditional family, and resides in Sanobougou II, a neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  

Hamidou Ousmane did not have the opportunity to go far in his studies, so he quickly learned how to buy and sell cellular phones and their accessories (cases, batteries, chargers, headphones etc.) and many other various goods.  He has been involved in this activity for ten years.  He works in his own shop located at the Sikasso bus terminal, and he sells mostly to travelers and transporters.  Thanks to the quality of his products, his goods are in high demand.

Eager to better satisfy the needs of an increasing number of customers, he joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago.  He has already received six loans which were all duly repaid.  He is now requesting his seventh loan to buy 65 cellular phones of various brands, 15 boxes of cases, about 15 chargers, 30 boxes of memory cards, 30 boxes of batteries, 20 dozen headphones of various kinds, about ten different watches and some belts.

Thanks to this loan, he is expecting monthly profits to reach 180,000 CFA francs which will be used to increase his business, contribute to the family's expenses and pay off his loan's interest.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and various other goods.

loans.name: Vip Vip Group

texts.en:
Julius, who is in his late 20s, is single. For a period of two years now, Julius has had a shop business selling foods of different kinds. He is doing fine in this field and his family is as well. He works from 5 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This is Julius's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, he managed to restock more different food items in his business. With the profit earned, he will proceed with building his house.  He will use this loan to increase the shop inventory, this will help him to reach more customers and increase more incomes. Julius's dream is to finish building his home.

He will share this loan with his loan group " VIP VIP " which has 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his shop's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat to cook and spices for the food.

loans.name: Jay Maa Tarini Self Help Group

texts.en: A few years back, a group of women from Chandikhole village stepped out to build a secure future for their families and made a group named Jay Maa Tarini Self Help Group. Members of the Jay Maa Tarini Self Help Group selected Mrs. Arati as the group leader. Mrs. Arati is 38 years old and lives with her husband and her three children. She took on the leadership of the group and started cultivating vegetables in their village by obtaining land on lease. They were successful with vegetable cultivation and selling vegetables like brinjal, cucumbers, beans, carrots, radishes, parwal, etc. Now she has started to cultivate peanuts. She has requested a loan to utilize in peanut cultivation. The loan amount will be utilized to purchase fertilizer and insecticide and also a portion will be spent on labor costs and water pumping.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizer and insecticide and to spend on labor costs and water pumping

loans.name: Walid

texts.en: Walid is 28 years old, a single man who lives in Hodeida, Yemen. He is a hard-working man who faces difficult challenges in his life. He has been making and selling old ovens for many years. He learned this business from his dad who couldn't work and stayed in the house. Walid is the breadwinner for his family. He applied for a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy materials to make old ovens and sell them to his customers.

loans.use: to buy materials to make old ovens and sell them to his customers.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Roberto en su negocio de comidas rápidas, porque con su credikiva anterior compró insumos para panadería, embutidos y cárnicos, pues tuvo un mayor capital para invertir. Desde que recibió sus credikiva han mejorado sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. Él envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva  donde agradece por confiar en él, “porque su crédito le ha servido de mucho.” En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará Cerveza, gaseosas y adecuará su local, con ello aumentará una vez mas su capital de trabajo y le abonará  bienestar a su futuro y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Roberto in his fast food business.  With his previous Kiva loan he bought bakery supplies, canned goods, and meat products because he had major capital to invest.  His income and his quality of life have improved since he received his Kiva loan.

He sends a message to Kiva lenders, whom he thanks for trusting in him "because his loan has been a big help to him."

Currently he's applying for a new Kiva loan to buy beer and soda and to fix up his locale.  With this he'll increase his working capital once again and create well-being for himself and his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda and to fix up his locale

loans.name: Thakurani Group

texts.en: Taruni is an active married lady, age 45, and a permanent resident of a rural village called Luthurbandh in Titilagarh block of Bolangir district of Odisha, India. Bolangir district is one of the underdeveloped areas of Odisha with 80% rural population. The lady sitting second from right with a raised hand is Taruni. She lives with her husband and four sons, ages 27, 24, 21 and 18 years. To increase the income of her family, in the year 2011, Taruni along with four other like-minded women from her village formed a group named Thakurani and availed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Taruni is running two businesses. One is procurement of seasonal agricultural products like paddy, pulses, etc., and selling them in the market at a higher price. Another one is a milk business. The husband of Taruni goes from market to market and procures the products. Taruni helps her husband to stock the materials in their residence. She also does her milk business from her house. Taruni earns a monthly income of 6,000 Indian rupees from the present business. From this small income, she can hardly manage her family's expenses. So, she wants to increase the volume of her business to increase her income. Taruni wants to invest the entire loan amount in the procurement of agricultural products. This will help her to make some extra income in the pick period. Taruni hopes to construct a house and get marriages for her sons. The other three active group members are Mira, Kabita and Bhumisuta, who are doing dry fish, tailoring and fancy item vending businesses respectively.

loans.use: to pay for procurement of paddy and pulses.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is 60 years old, married with four children.

Vitaliana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like canned goods, laundry soap, cooking oil, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Vitaliana has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Vitaliana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like canned goods, laundry soap, cooking oil, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est née en  Novembre 1977 à Kiffosso sous-préfecture de Yorosso (cercle de Koutiala). Mère de 2 enfants avec un époux actuellement en aventure en Angleterre, elle réside avec ses deux enfants chez son père à Kamalen Sirakoro, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Mariam mène il y’a environ dix ans les activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes wax, draps de lit, chaussures, tissus brodés, balaies, etc. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y'a maintenant cinq ans. Après  plusieurs prêt solidaires dans une association des femmes de sa localité, elle est à son  quatrième prêt individuel avec lequel elle est compte acheter 15 pièces de pagne wax, 25 paires de chaussures de qualités différentes, 10 complets de tissus brodés et des colis de balaies. Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et à Bobo Dioulasso (république de Burkina Faso) avant de les revendre en détail et de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 110 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mariam was born in November 1977 in Kiffosso, in the district of Yorosso, cercle of Koutiala.  She is the mother of two children.  Her husband left for England, so she is living at her father's home with her two children, in Kamalen Sirakoro, one of the suburbs of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

For the past ten years Mariam has been selling wax "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics), bedsheets, shoes, embroidered fabrics, brooms etc.  She works from home and also sells door to door in Sikasso, where she is a very popular seller, thanks to the quality of her merchandise.

In order to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago.  After taking several solidarity loans through a local women's association, she is now taking her fourth individual loan.  She is planning to use this loan to buy 15 wax pagnes, 25 pairs of shoes of various quality, ten pieces of embroidered fabric (each measuring 1 x 3 m) and some boxes of brooms.  She buys her merchandise locally and in Bobo Dioulasso (republic of Burkina Faso) and resells door to door, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base which mostly consists of women.  Her previous loans have been duly repaid.

Thanks to this loan, Mariam is expecting monthly profits to reach 110,000 CFA francs, which will be used in part to contribute to the family's expenses, to pay off her loan's interest, while the rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various items such as pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics), shoes, fabrics and brooms.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar, labora en el centro de la cuidad de Medellín desde hace más de 28 años. Artesano desde su juventud, gracias a la tradición familiar y a un curso que realizó en un instituto en donde logró desarrollar todo su potencial.
En la actualidad se dedica a la elaboración de bolsos y calzado, trabajo que realiza de lunes a sábado de nueve de la mañana a seis de la tarde. Gracias a esta actividad Julio genera lo necesario para vivir.
Su mayor deseo es mejorar las ventas y aumentar sus ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materia prima como cuero, caña de flecha, hebillas entre otros.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar has worked downtown in the city of Medellín  for 28 years. He has been an artisan since his youth thanks to family tradition and a course he took at an institute where he succeeded in developing all of his potential.

Currently he makes bags and shoes, working Monday to Saturday from nine in the morning until six in the evening. Through his business he generates what he needs to live

His greatest desire is to improve sales and increase his earnings so he can have a better quality of life. That is the reason he has requested a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of raw material such as leather, arrow cane and buckles, among other items.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as leather, arrow cane and buckles, among other items.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives in Aygestan village with her husband, three children and her father-in-law, who is required to get a retirement pension.

Tamara has been running a farm for 16 years already. Currently her farm includes 10 chickens. She cultivates corn and tomatoes and besides that, grows apricots, plums, nuts and apple trees.

Together with her family, Tamara works hard to gather a good harvest and sell the harvest in the local market. Realizing that agriculture is the only source of income for their family, Tamara would like to enlarge her business. She has requested this loan to purchase corn seeds and hire workers to start the cultivation process.

It is very difficult for Tamara and her husband to do the cultivation process alone. That's why the loan is very important for them. Tamara hopes that with the help of this loan she will be able to get more harvest and this will significantly increase their income, which is very important for covering the family's needs.

loans.use: to pay for corn seeds and hire workers to start the cultivation process

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives peacefully in their hilly village with his family. He is a farmer who plants and harvests corn in their field. With his desire to uplift their living condition, Wilson also engages in taking care of hogs while his wife is his partner in growing their business.

Wilson wanted to take care of more hogs than what he has now. He is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy piglets to grow and feed for maintenance. He hopes to get higher profits and be able to build up a piggery house for his hogs.

loans.use: to buy piglets to grow and feed for maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for her hogs

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga has operated a greengrocery business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a mixed farming business, which earns her additional income. She faces a major challenge of inadequate capital in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting now, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, including potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She joined Yehu because of favorable lending requirements, and she thanks Kiva for the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables to resell, including potatoes, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Due to financial difficulty, Rosalyn engages in the cooking and selling of snack foods in her community to earn additional income. She is 54 years old and has three adult-age children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living to give their children a better life. In this regard, Rosalyn aims to make her business profitable in order to gain sufficient income. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy flour, sugar, oil, plastics, sticks, bananas, peanuts and sweet potatoes to be cooked and sold in her community. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, plastics, sticks, bananas, peanuts and sweet potatoes to be cooked and sold

loans.name: Mahmadsharif

texts.ru: Махмадшариф житель района Бохтар Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ему 25 лет. У него жена и две дочки - пятилетняя и трехлетняя. Махмадшариф уже два года совместно с женой занимается торговлей. У них имеется магазин, где они продают продукты питания, в том числе: сахар, масло, молочные продукты, печенье, шоколад, макарон, консервированные продукты и хозяйственные товары. Махмадшариф закупает свой товар оптом с города Душанбе, привозит в свой район и продает по розничной цене. Кредит запрашивает для приобретения ассортимента товара (продуктов питания) с целью увеличения товарооборота. В будущем Махмадшариф планирует расширить свой торговый бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи.
texts.en:
Mahmadsharif is a resident of the Bohtar district in the Khatlon province of Tajikistan.  He is 25 years old, married, and has two daughters.  His daughters are five and three years old.

Mahmadsharif and his wife have worked in retail for two years already.  They own a shop where they sell food products such as sugar, butter, dairy products, cookies, chocolate, pasta, canned food as well as household goods.  Mahmadsharif buys his merchandise in bulk quantities in Dushanbe, transports it back home and resells at a retail price.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of food products, which will allow him to increase his turnover.  In the future, he would like to expand his commercial business and open another store.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products.

loans.name: Narantungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantungalag, 22 years old, lives with her husband, son and parents, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her parents have retired from work. Her husband and father stay at home, caring for her son. Her mother works as a waitress at a restaurant. She, herself, has been working as a baker at a bakery.

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase building and insulation materials, such as fiberglass, bricks, cement and planks. Using those materials, she and her husband will repair the house. As a result, the whole family will live in a comfortable and warm place. More importantly, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emitting less smoke and thereby contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking young woman, who deeply cares for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Kambi

texts.en:
Kambi, aged 44 years, is married to Dzame, a housewife, and they are blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kambi operates a charcoal-selling business, selling on a retail basis to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business, especially during the rainy season when it becomes hard to get charcoal. His dream is to establish a shop to sell household consumables in the near future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Serjmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Serjmaa, 40 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She sells homemade foods to vendors at an outdoor market. Moreover, she and her husband make wooden products such as frames, doors and chairs. 

During this period of time, demand for wooden products increases, but due to a lack of finances, she can't afford to purchase raw materials. So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase planks and paints. As a result, she and her husband can continue to make and sell wooden products to local people. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase planks and paints to make wooden furniture.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 49 years old and is now widowed. She lives with her three children in a rural community. She owns and manages a small variety store to generate additional income. She aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income to satisfy the family's needs. To improve the business, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more inventory for resale including snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, soaps, soft drinks, and candies. She hopes that someday she will make the business profitable as she continue to work hard for it.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for resale including snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, soaps, soft drinks, and candies

loans.name: Melba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Melba, 56 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia los demás trabajan y son independientes habitan en la ciudad de Granada, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y elaboración de ropa para bebes tales como  sabanas, camisas, fundas para almohadas, vestidos, zapatos, variedades para vestir a los recienacidos. Comenzo a los 15 años de edad a trabajar en la costura, su madre les enseño este oficio a ella y sus hermanas, gracias a lo que aprendieron han sobrevivido. Actualmente además de vender ropa para recienacidos  también venden ropa nueva para damas y caballeros desde hace 5 años esta actividad la puso para conseguir otras formas de ingresos. 
Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar tela, hilos de diferentes colores, toallas para baños, pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, etc. Esta inversión le permitirá vender y captar nuevos clientes. Uno de sus planes es tener ahorros para su vejez aunque dice que sus hijos no la dejaran sola desea pero quiere tener lo propio. Su meta próxima es comprar telas para elaborar mas bordados y darlos a conocer en ferias, mercados y parques.
texts.en:
Melba is 56 years old.  She is the mother of 4 children of which only one studies.  The others work and are independent.  She lives in the city of Granada and she sells new clothes. She makes clothes for infants such as sheets, shirts, pillowcases, dresses, shoes, and various other items for infant wear. She began to work in sewing when she was 15 years old.  Her mother taught this trade to her and to her sisters.  Thanks to what they learned, she has survived. In addition to selling infant wear, she also sells new clothes for men and women. She began to get income from this activity 5 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fabric, different colored thread, bath towels, pants, blouses, underwear, etc. This loan will allow her to sell and to gain new clients. One of her plans is to have savings for her retirement. Even though her children say they will not leave her by herself, she wants to have her own savings. Her next goal is to buy fabric to make more embroideries and show them in fairs, markets, and parks.

loans.use: to buy fabric, towels, pants, blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 36 years old, is married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.  She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 18 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ramona Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Ramona del Socorro reside en el pueblo de Condega a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, ella es madre soltera y reside en su propia casa de habitación junto a dos de sus hijas, la cual ella a criado y educado desde hace mucho tiempo con esfuerzo propio.

Esta señora actualmente se desempeña como conserje de una casa de habitación desde hace aproximadamente unos seis años de manera continua y estable, ella labora de lunes a viernes de 7 am a las 4 pm y los fines de semana ella viaja a algunas comunidades aledañas a vender ropa de todo tipo así como cosméticos.

Ella se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento. pertenece al programa de alianza de agua y saneamiento. esto le servirá para la construcción de una batería sanitaria que incluye servicio higiénico, lavamanos y ducha así como la pila séptica ya que las condiciones actuales no son muy buenas.

 De esta manera ella quiere tener el servicio y la ducha en la parte de adentro de su casa y tener una vivienda mas digna mejorando las condiciones de su vida, ya que las letrinas contaminan el medio ambiente y por medio de este proyecto podrá gozar de buena salud e higiene, evitando enfermedades.

este programa va dirigido al sector mas bajo, ya que sin este financiamiento sera imposible realizar la construcción de estos servicios.
texts.en: Ramona lives in the village of Condega some 35 kilometers north of the city of Estelí. She is a single mother who lives in her own home along with her daughters, whom she has raised and educated on her own for a very long time. She has made a living as a caretaker at a home for the past six years, which provides her with continuity and stability. She works Monday-Friday from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m., and on the weekends she travels to some of the surrounding communities to sell all kinds of clothing as well as cosmetics. She came to the offices of Kiva partner CEPRODEL requesting a loan to belong to the water and sanitation alliance. This will allow her to build a bathroom that will include a toilet, shower and sink as well as a septic tank, since the current conditions aren't very good. In this way she will have these essential services inside her home and have a more dignified place to live with improved conditions, since the latrines contaminate the environment and through this project she will be able to enjoy better health and hygiene and avoid illnesses. This program targets the lowest class, because without this funding it would be impossible to build these services.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like cement, iron and porcelain as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Al-Forsan Group

texts.en: Al-Forsan is a group of three women from Sana'a, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials (YER). Nadia is a 29-year-old, illiterate, married woman with four children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented house. The family bought a small piece of land to build their own house, but Nadia needs money to pay for construction supplies, so she applied for a loan in the amount of 40,000 YER. After completing the building of her house, she hopes to start thinking of a small business to help improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to complete the building of her house

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en:
Khatia is 28 years old. She lives in Gori district with her husband Ramaz. She works at the local marketing research agency as an interviewer, earning a small monthly salary that is hardly enough to cover her family's monthly expenses.

Khatia previously requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business, but without any success. Her loan requests were all rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Khatia also requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credit with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income.

Khatia will use her loan to start trading. She will go to the Sarpi district to purchase clothes and household goods at the wholesale price, bring them back to her district, and sell them to villagers with a price markup to earn a good profit. She will use part of the profit to reinvest in and develop her business and part for her family's well being.

loans.use: To start trading in clothes and household goods

loans.name: Elizita

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Elizita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Elizita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy, biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 45 years old and married with six children.

Sally works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

Sally has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from furniture making and direct selling.

Sally aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Diyo

texts.en:
Diyo is 35 years old, married and has five children; four of his children attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Diyo operates an M-pesa (money float) mobile money transfer business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Diyo faces a major challenge of capital in his business. He dreams of establishing another M-pesa shop in the future. With the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, he will buy credit cards for sale, and will use the other cash to renovate his place of business.

loans.use: to buy credit cards for sale and renovate his place of business.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 58 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cooking oil, candies, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store.

Luciana has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an additional income from food vending.

Luciana aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like cooking oil, candies, biscuits, canned goods and shampoo to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dhakra

texts.en: Dhakra is an 18-year-old married woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She didn`t complete her studying. She is a housewife who tries to raise her child well.  She washes her clothes by hand because she doesn't have money to buy a washing machine. So she applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a washing machine. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Mercedita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, rice, bread, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша 20-летняя молодая женщина. Она неудачно вышла замуж и развелась с мужем. В данное время Бунафша живет у родителей вместе с сёстрами и братом в районе Бохтар. После развода Бунафша быстро справилась с трудностями и начала работать в сфере торговли. Она занимается продажей нижнего женского белья уже два года. Ее торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города Кургантюбе. Бунафша в месяц 4-раза закупает свой товар с оптового рынка города Душанбе. Сейчас Бунафша обратилась за кредитом для приобретения товара (нижнего женского белья), чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Bunafsha is a young woman of 20. She was unlucky in marriage and divorced her husband. Presently, together with her sisters and brother, she lives in her parents' home in the Bohtar region of Tajikistan. After her divorce, Bunafsha quickly overcame her difficult situation and started working in retail. She has been selling women's undergarments for the past two years. Her retail spot is located at the central market of the city of Kurgantube. Bunafsha restocks her merchandise 4 times per month at the wholesale market in the city of Dushanbe. 

Bunafsha is requesting this loan to purchase more goods (women's underwear) in order to increase the volume of her sales.

loans.use: to purchase women's undergarments in order to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Zarob

texts.ru:
Зароб житель города Куляб, расположенный на юге Таджикистана. Ему 45 лет. Он женат и у него сын и дочь, которые учатся в школе. Вместе с ними в одном доме живут еще один его брат и две племянники. 
Уже год как Зароб занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает бычков со скотного рынка города Куляб и близлежащих деревень, откармливает их в течение 30 дней и затем продает с наценкой. Заробу в его деятельности помогает жена. Одновременно Зароб и его жена занимаются земледелием. Кредит берет для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Zarob lives in the city of Kulob in the south of Tajikistan. He is 45 years old, married, and has a son and a daughter who attend school. The family shares their home with one of Zarob's brothers and two nephews. 

For the past year, Zarob has been buying and reselling cattle. He purchases calves at the livestock market that serves Kulob and nearby villages, fattens the animals for 30 days, and then resells them at a profit. Zarob's wife helps her husband in this occupation, and both of them are also engaged in farming. Zarob is taking this loan to buy cattle for subsequent resale.

loans.use: to purchase cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Jose Antono

texts.es: Don José, es un cliente que vive con su pareja quien trabaja como secretaria, ambos tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, la labor de José es el de publicista para una revista desde hace dos años trabajo que le gusta mucho y espera crecer más adelante, por ahora con sus ingresos desea invertir en la mejora del techo de su vivienda los cuales ya tienen muchos años y se están deteriorando, es por eso la solicitud de este primer crédito, para que su salario le pueda alcanzar para los otros gastos del hogar y de escuela.
texts.en:
Don José lives with his partner who works as a secretary. They have two school-age children. For the past two years, José has been working as a publicist for a magazine. He enjoys his work tremendously and hopes to keep growing in the future.

For now, he wants to invest his earnings into improvements to his home which he has owned for many years. José wants to repair the roof of his home, which has deteriorated. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan since his salary will be used for household and school expenses.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and crossbeams in order to repair the roof.

loans.name: Zarrina
