Su dificultad del negocio son los ladrones y mal uso de la calle porque pueden caerse los productos que distribuye, y tambien en ocaciones a su sobrina quien tiene una discapcidad ya que no hay con quien dejarla para que la cuide. No es casada, ni tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo va a comprar manteles, platos, carnes para poder repartir a mas clientes los pedidos. Su sueño es compartir junto a su familia y poder hacer su negocio más grande.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  She started making food for friends and family.  Then she specialized in different a la carte dishes.  She now sells to people that she knows, and they hire her for buffets (specific foods).  One of the things she makes is sweets, which she sells by order.

She works with her mother from 9:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m, and she works a night schedule if she has orders for specific dishes.

The difficulty she has in the business is thieves.  Also, with the bad state of the streets you can fall with all of the products she distributes.  Additionally, at times there is difficulty with her niece who has a disability.  This is because there is no one to leave her with who will take care of her.  She is not married, nor does she have children.

She will use the loan to buy tablecloths, plates, and meat in order to be able to distribute orders to more customers.

Her dream is to share together with her family and to be able to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, plates, and meat.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Ms. Altantsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and mother-in-law in a Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia.  Her husband, Ayush, is a 46-year-old, part-time worker at a local power plant.  Her mother-in-law is retired and stays home. 

Ms. Altantsetseg has been running a clothing sales business at a rental counter of the local market since 2006.  She is now planning to start her own grocery store in a food market and is requesting 7,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her business.  She will assist her husband in running the grocery store in order to boost their family income.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her new business.

loans.name: Konga

texts.en: Konga says she benefited from her previous loans by increasing her working capital, buying more items (sugar, cooking oil, etc.), and paying for her children’s school fees.  She is now requesting another loan to increase her inventory.  She says that she is happy for Finance Sudan Limited's support of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.name: Bertsetseg

texts.en:
Bertsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband, Altangerel, takes care of their livestock and provides transportation services between the countryside and the province center. Her daughter, Narangarav, age 16, and son, Yesontomor, age 15, go to local schools. 

She has been running a grocery counter in the local market since she moved to the province center. She has obtained a lot of experience and has close relationships with suppliers and customers. She is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic meat products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, diligent and positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic meat products to sell.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a single, 24-year-old farmer. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 25,000. He also operates a motorcycle transport business to supplement his income. 

Erick is applying for his second loan term with KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers for his crops. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his siblings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 36 years old and married to Jira Kwekwe, who is a housewife. They have been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. 

For the past ten years, Rashid has operated a green grocery business, selling at retail to his neighbours and passersby. He also does farming, which earns him another source of income. He cited stiff competition from other vegetable stall operators as his major challenge.

With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase an ox to be used in ploughing his land during plantation season. 

He decided to join Yehu because the loan lead time is short and Yehu is responsive to customers' needs.

loans.use: To purchase an ox to be used in ploughing his land during plantation season.

loans.name: Gulguna

texts.ru: Гулгуна молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Гулгуна живет вместе со своими родителями. Гулгуна 2 года назад обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и 2 года назад организовала свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Она реализует продукты питания в центре своего села, где нет конкуренции. Ее бизнес идет отлично. Так как она очень умная и шустрая справляется с бизнесом сама. Она планирует развивать бизнес дальше. Для этого она должна расширить ассортимент товара. Она запрашивает займ а сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки продуктов питания. Она как добросовестная женщина обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Gulguna is a young and cheerful woman. She's 20-years-old, single, and doesn't have children.  She lives with her parents.  Two years ago she took an "Achieving Success" course organized by  the Business Women's Association and started up a food vending business.  She sells food products in the center of her village, where there's no competition, and it's going great, because she nimble and smart at running the business.  Gulguna has plans to develop the business further, and for that she needs to expand her range of goods.  She is seeking a loan for 2000USD to buy food products.  As the conscientious woman she is, she promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy food items to expand her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Clebert

texts.fr: Clébert est un homme de 32 ans célibataire et père 2 enfants de 11 mois  et 03 ans. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis quelques années où il vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour agrandir une boutique de vêtements et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Clebert is a 32-year-old man, single, and a father of two children, who are 11 months and 3 years old. For a number of years, he has been a merchant in a local market, where he sells secondhand clothing and clothing for young people, men, and women (according to the seasons and to what's available).

Because he does not have much capital, he has to go to the outlets each weekend in order to buy the clothes at retail that he displays in his stall. This is not really profitable, [and explains] the importance of a loan for his business. A loan will allow him to buy a mixed bale [of clothing]. 

He will use the earnings that the loan will bring him to expand his clothing shop and to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of different types of clothes

loans.name: Crescence

texts.fr: Crescence est une femme de 41 ans mariée mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( gombo, légumes, maniocs, plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 20 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai augmenter son stock de vivres en achetant en gros ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qu'elle réinvestira en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Crescence is a 41-year-old woman who is married and a mother. She is a retailer and has been selling seasonal fresh food items (gumbo, vegetables, cassava, plantains) to retail customers at a local market for 20 years. She knows the suppliers well, as she does her customers, whom she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in her line of work. However, she often has stock shortages as she is forced to use up all of her inventory before she can afford to buy more, because of her limited capital. She would like to increase her inventory of food items by buying some wholesale; this will not only increase her sales, but also her profits. She will reinvest part of those profits in her business so that she can expand it, and the other part will be used to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with two children. 

She proposes to use this loan of KES 40,000 to buy more clothes for sale and use the anticipated profits to open another boutique. 

She has been in this business for four years and operates in a busy environment. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was KES 20,000, which she repaid successfully. 

Pamela hopes that in five years time the business will have progressed and she will be able to open other branches.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has owned an elementary school providing education to young children for the last 20 years. She says that lack of adequate facilities and capital to establish a modern classroom have been her major challenges. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sand and cement to repair her school to provide a good environment for learning. She appreciates the last Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement to repair her school to provide a good environment.

loans.name: Buyanbadrah

texts.en: Mr. Buyanbadrah is 25 years old and lives with his wife in a Ger, located in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Lhagvajav, works at a local company.  This borrower has been running a taxi service business in town since 2008.  He has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years.  He had exchanged his car to a better, second-hand, Eco-friendly car to provide his taxi service business in town.  He is now requesting 2,300,000 MNT to pay off the vehicle.  He is a hardworking, diligent, and optimistic man.

loans.use: to pay for his Eco-friendly second-hand car.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is 32 years old.  She is married to Mohamed and together they have three children, two of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a green grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  In addition, she also sells dry fish which earns her additional income.  She mentioned that lack of enough capital has been a major problem in her business.

With this loan she would like to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions and kales.  She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning procedures.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions and kales.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is returning for another Kiva loan of 80,000 KES.  The previous loan had a great impact, as she was able to make good returns.  With this loan, she wants to expand her existing business by purchasing washing detergents, wheat flour, maize flour, soft drinks, and cooking fat oil.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders and Yehu microfinance for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents, wheat flour, maize flour, soft drinks and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anne Clarisse

texts.fr: Anne est une femme de 29 ans célibataire mère de 3 enfants de 3 et 8 ans.Tous deux vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail (arachides, maïs,couscous, mortiers et pièrre à écraser) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 5 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera s'approvisionner en mortiers, sacs d'arachides, maïs et couscous et pièrre à écraser pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anne Clarisse is a 29-year-old woman who is single and the mother of 3 children aged between 3 and 8. Two of them go to school. She is a retailer and has been selling various items (groundnuts, maize, couscous, mortars and pestles), depending on the season, at a local market for 5 years. She knows her suppliers well, and she knows her customers, whom she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in her line of work, especially well. However, she is constantly facing stock shortages as, due to her limited funds, she is forced to use up her whole inventory before she can afford to buy more. 

She would like to buy some mortars and pestles and bags of groundnuts, maize and couscous so that she has a good inventory which will enable her to better satisfy the constant demand from her customers and to avoid stock shortages. She plans to save up her profits so that she can both expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy mortars and pestles, bags of groundnuts, maize and couscous.

loans.name: Patrick Aimé

texts.fr: Patrick est une homme de 25 ans célibataire sans enfant. Il est commerçant et a ouvert un petite quincaillerie   qu'il gère depuis 9 mois. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'il a acquis au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais il se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Il souhaitera s'approvisionner en serrures, machettes, récipients et autres...  pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Patrick is a 25-year-old single man with no children. He is a merchant and opened a small hardware store, that he has now been managing for nine months. He knows his suppliers well, and especially [he knows] his customers, who he has acquired over time thanks to his experience in this area. 

But because Patrick does not have much capital, he constantly has disruptions in his stock, because he has to sell it all before he can buy new merchandise. He would like to procure some locks, machetes, receptacles, etc. to have a larger stock, which will allow him to better satisfy the constant demand of his customers and to avoid disruptions.

He will use his earnings not only to expand his business but also to support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise (locks, machetes, receptacles, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. Empezó con un pequeño negocio en la esquina de su casa luego el padre lo ayudo en una camioneta distribuyendo los embutidos y queso. Poco a poco incremento su negocio ahora le gusta lo que hace ya que a tenido buenos ingresos.

Trabaja solo desde las 6h00 hasta las 18h00. Su trabajo es de repartir y vender lacteos en las tiendas tambien vende huevo, queso. Su dificultad es cuando sufre recaídas por su enfermedad no puede trabajar ya que el es pvvs (paciente viviendo con vih sida), si es casado, no tiene hijos.

Con el préstamo va a comprar queso y huevo. Su sueño es disfrutar junto a su familia compartir juntos y poder tener una casa propia y una camioneta para poder distribuir los productos.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  He started with a small business in the corner of his house.  Then his father helped him with a pickup truck, distributing the sausages and cheese.  He was increasing his business little by little.  

He now likes what he does because he has had good income.  He works alone from 6:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  His work is delivering and selling dairy products in the stores.  He also sells eggs and cheese.  His difficulty is when he suffers relapses with his illness he is not able to work.  He is a PVVS (patient living with HIV/AIDS).  He is married, but he does not have children.

He will use the loan to buy cheese and eggs.

His dream is to enjoy being together and sharing with his family.  He also dreams of being able to have his own house and a pickup truck in order to distribute his products.

loans.use: to buy cheese and eggs.

loans.name: Saber

texts.en:
Saber is 43 years old and lives in Gaza, Palestine.  He is married and has 4 children, three boys and a girl, who are at school.  He works as a gardener since 2005.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy weeding and grass machines for his gardening project.

He hopes that this loan will help to increase his productivity and improve his income in order to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy weeding and grass machines for his gardening project.

loans.name: Jeimi

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Jeimy quien con su pasado credikiva aplicado en su miscelánea,  logró aumentar sus inventarios y ofrecer nuevos y diversos productos, como carne porcina y lácteos, así como celulares perfumería cosméticos, ropa interior para damas e infantil. Su negocio ha crecido y ahora hay mayores ingresos para su hogar. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Agradecida por el apoyo al negocio”. En la actualidad está aplicando una vez más a un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa perfumería y cosméticos, pues se acercan uno de las temporadas comerciales mas importantes, donde las ventas se incrementan, como el día internacional  de las madres. Y esto es justamente lo que hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa y de las madres de sus clientes las mujeres mas felices por tener lo que ellas necesitan.
texts.en: Thanks for supporting Jeimy, who used her previous microloan on her general store and succeeded in expanding her inventory and offering new and diversified products, such as pork and dairy products, as well as cell phones, perfumes, and cosmetics, ladies' underwear, and baby clothes.  Her business has grown and she is making more money for her household.  She says to her Kiva lenders, she is "Thankful for the support of the business."  She is now applying again for a microloan, with which she will buy clothing, perfumes, and cosmetics, since one of the commercial times of the year which is most important is coming up, which is the internationally recognized Mother's Day.  And this is precisely what will make her loan a successful investment and will make the mothers of her customers the most happy because they will get just what they need.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Risan

texts.en:
Risan is from Iraq.  He is a 23-year-old, single client who lives with his parents.  Risan assists his father with providing the family living.
Risan owns a small shop where he sells grains and cereals.  In 2011, Risan inherited this business from his father and, since then, he has been running this business all by himself.  He has gained much experience in this field since he had been helping his father ever since he was young.  Now, Risan has a good reputation in his neighborhood due to the good quality and variety of goods that he offers.

Risan is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his shop.  He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may take better care of his parents.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 35-year-old widow with seven children between the ages of 3 and 21 years old.  Her children still attend school and are under her care, which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a retail shop business selling consumables to her neighbors.  She also does farming which earns her additional income.  Fatuma mentions seasonality as her major challenge in the business.  She dreams of establishing a grocery business in the future. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase additional groceries, including wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar, and cooking fat oil.  She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, sugar, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a 50-year-old widow and mother of 7 children, all of whom have completed school.  She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.  For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling items like wheat flour and maize flour.  She cites the high cost of purchasing stock to be her major challenge.  Kache dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, sugar, salt, cooking fat oil, and kerosene for resale.  She decided to join Yehu because it is easy to join and convenient in terms of savings and assessing loans.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, salt, cooking fat oil, and kerosene.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: La necesidad de generar ingresos para  lograr bienestar de su hogar y las ganas de trabajar impulsaron a la señora Carmen, mujer viuda,  a emprender en el año 1973  su negocio, de preparación y venta de desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Su negocio lo ofrece en un local ubicado al lado de su residencia, donde atiende principalmente conductores de camiones que llegan de viaje a la ciudad, transeúntes que habitualmente pasan por sus instalaciones y que son trabajadores de ese sector. Sus ventas las realiza  de contado, y en un horario que inicia a las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche. Con sus financiamientos su negocio ha mejorado, habiendo realizado 6 financiamientos, que han fortalecido su capital de trabajo, sus ventas y sus utilidades. Su mayor desafío es atender la creciente clientela, porque en la medida en que crece su capital se vuelve insuficiente para responder a la demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, Séptimo financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará en un mayor volumen y de contado, materiales e insumos para preparar  alimentos,(arroz, cárnicos, legumbres, elatados, azucar, sal) agregando nuevos menús a su servicio diario. Con esta inversión su credikiva proyecta éxito porque está enfocada en la demanda de su mercado y a este es al que con mucho cuidado sirve, la señora Carmen.
texts.en:
The need to generate income for the improved well-being of her home and the desire to work were what drove Carmen, a widowed woman, to start her business in 1973.  She prepares and sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner meals.  She offers this service at her business premises located next to her home.  Her customers are mainly truck drivers that come to the city on a trip, and pedestrians that habitually pass by her stall and who are workers in the area.  

Her sales are done in cash, and her daily schedule begins at 6 a.m. and ends at 10 p.m.  With financing, her business has improved.  She has had six loans and they have strengthened her working capital, her sales, and her utilities.  

Her greatest challenge is to pay attention to her growing clientele, because as her customer base grows, her capital is insufficient to respond to the demand.  This is the reason that she requests a loan through Kiva.

This is her seventh loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy those materials and ingredients, wholesale and with cash, that she needs to prepare her foods (rice, meats, vegetables, canned items, sugar, salt), adding new menu items to her daily service.  With this investment, she expects to be successful because she is very focused on the demand in her market, and she serves this market with a lot of care.

loans.use: to buy those materials and ingredients, in greater volume and with cash, that she uses to prepare her foods (rice, meats, vegetables, canned items, sugar, salt).

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is requesting another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES.  With this loan, she plans to expand her existing business.  She wants to purchase plastic shoes and plastic tins for resale.  The previous loan had a great impact and she was able to run her business without a shortage of stock and with a good profit.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes and plastic tins for resale.

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en: Kayed is a 20-year-old, young man from Gaza.  He owns a grocery store since 2010.  He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a refrigerator and to install a glass door for his grocery store.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase the goods displayed and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and to install a glass door for his grocery store.

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the Akhaltsikhe District with her son.  Elza requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up without any success.  Her loan request was always rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.  Elza’s only source of income is her small monthly salary, 250 Laris/month, as a waitress at a local cafe.  This is hardly enough to buy food for the family.  According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Elza requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business.  Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of credits with soft conditions to the country rural poor who do not have access to credit products.  This group is regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income.  With the received credit, Elza will begin selling clothing and household goods.  She plans to go to Turkey to purchase the clothing and household goods at wholesale prices and then resell them among her villagers.  Elza will do her best to increase the family income and improve the living conditions for her son.  This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the life of the family.

loans.use: to buy clothing and household goods for resale.

loans.name: Mariela Maribel

texts.es:
MARIELA tiene 22 años de dad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC VIRGEN DE BAÑOS está formada por en la comunidad mama Sara de Cerritos, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa.

Mariela se ddeica a la agr4icultura a la siembras de fréjol, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes,semillas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.

El sueño es independisarce, tener terrenos propios para sembrar terminar los estudios. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear y disfrutar de las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mariela is 22 years old, single, and has no children.  She lives with her parents in the Chillanes province of Bolívar.

The communal bank VIRGEN DE BAÑOS is made up of members in the community of Mama Sara de Cerritos, about 30 minutes away from the Cooperative's office.

Mariela works in farming and grows beans, and she also raises cattle.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy organic additives for the soil, fertilizers, and seeds.  With the help of this credit, she will be able to buy what she needs for her planting.

Her dream is to become independent, and to have her own fields that she can plant, and to finish her studies.  In her free time, she likes to go out and enjoy the parties and feast days in her community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, organic additives, and seeds.

loans.name: María Maxima

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace más de 30 años aprendió el oficio de la elaboración de hamacas; su hermana fue quien le enseño. Hoy en día elabora hamacas de seda y poliseda. Antes solo se dedicaba a las labores agrícolas junto con sus padres. Pero desde hace 24 años se dedica por completo a la elaboración de las hamacas, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Elabora tres hamacas a la semana. De los tres hijos solo una estudio y las dos mujeres ya esta casadas. 

Los insumos para elaborar hamacas las adquiere en el pueblo más cercano,  para llegar ahí aborda un autobús; viaja cada 15 días en compañía de su hijo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos cajas de hilo de seda y manguillos. Ella elabora hamacas por encargo y también para el comercio y con el préstamo podrá vender aún más. Su objetivo es establecer un puesto de venta fija en donde pueda tratar directamente con los clientes.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, and married with 3 children.  For more than 30 years, she has been making hammocks for sale, as her sister taught her to do.  Today, she makes her hammocks out of silk and Poliseda (a silken polyester fiber).  Before that she worked as farm labor with her parents, but for the past 24 years, she has dedicated all of her time to the creation of hammocks, with which she helps her husband with the household expenses.  She makes 3 hammocks per week.  Of her three children, just one is in school and the two women have already gotten married.

She acquires the materials to make her hammocks in the closest town, and to get there, she takes a bus, a trip which she makes every 15 days with her son.

The loan which she is asking from Fundación Campo is to buy two boxes of silk thread and hammock handles.  She makes hammocks to order and also for general sales, and with this loan, she will be able to sell more.  Her goal is to establish a fixed sales locale where she can sell directly to her customers.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of silk thread and hammock handles.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 26 años, es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí,  vive con su señora, quien se llama Rossana. El es un joven muy trabajador, que lucha y se esfuerza por salir adelante.
Roberto tiene una casa de venta de celulares, accesorios, reparaciones, fotocopias también venta de helados, tortas y con el tiene los medios necesarios para poder seguir ayudando con los gastos de la casa.
El solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de accesorios, repuestos para celulares, y demás productos para poder seguir dando a sus clientes un buen servicio. El es un joven que quiere salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 26 years old and is from the city of Paraguarí. He lives with his wife, Rossana, and he is a very hardworking young man who is dedicated to his job and making a way for himself in life.

Roberto runs a small business where he sells new and used cellular phones as well as accessories for phones. Roberto also repairs broken or damaged cell phones, offers photocopy services at his store and also sells ice cream, cakes and other food items to clients. With the profits from his store, Roberto supports his family.

With the support from this loan, Roberto plans to purchase accessories and replacement cell phone parts to stock his store and continue offering high quality services to his clients. He hopes this investment will help him to continue providing for his loved ones and will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and replacement cell phone parts for resale at his store.

loans.name: La Solucion Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Solucion” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad de 2000 Fatima. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades con las que quieren ayudar a su comunidad y sus familias, ya que ellos son de una zona alejada, en donde no tienen mucho acceso a la comunicación.
En su mayoría son mujeres de campo, que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudan a sus familias por medio de su trabajo. Gladys, se dedica a la cría, venta y faena de animales de corral, con este arduo trabajo está saliendo adelante y lucha por poder crecer.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que con ello podrá seguir con su trabajo. Ella quiere que su comunidad vaya en crecimiento, para que de esa forma puedan tener un mejor acceso para ellas y sus hijos y familiares.
texts.en:
The community group, "La Solucion" (The Solution), is made up of several women who are all neighbors in the community 2000 Fatima. The group members make a living in various trades and crafts which they leverage to support their families. They live in a remote area without ample access to technology and communication methods.

The majority of the women in the group are from rural areas, and all of them work very hard to support their families and help with household expenses. Gladys, one of the group members, makes a living raising and breeding farm animals. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase feed for her animals, and she hopes that this investment will strengthen her operation and allow her to continue supporting her family. Gladys hopes that her community will continue developing and moving forward toward better access to utilities and modern communication methods.

loans.use: to purchase feed for raising her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her house.

loans.name: Sunilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Sunilda es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltera, tiene 34 años, ella es masajista kinesiologa realiza tratamientos de rehabilitación pos cirugía lesiones deportivas entre otros. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta.
Tiene un pequeño consultorio ubicado en un lugar muy concurrido de la zona, y que está creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo que hace. Sunilda comenta que no tiene mucha competencia y que eso le ayuda mucho.
Solicito el crédito para la financiación de un curso de especialización para así poder brindar la mejor atención posible a sus clientes, además de eso agradece por la a oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sunilda is 34 years old, single, and is from the city of Curuguaty. She is a massage therapist who helps patients rehabilitate after surgery and sports-related injuries and is a very honest, responsible person.

Sunilda operates a small massage practice near the center of her town, and her practice is growing thanks to her hard work and dedication. One of the factors she has pinpointed in relation to her success is the present lack of competition for the services she provides.

With the support from this loan, Sunilda plans to take a specialized kinesiology and massage therapy course to expand her skill set and offer higher quality services to her clients. She is grateful for this opportunity and knows that this course will help her take her practice to the next level.

loans.use: to expand her massage therapy skills by taking a specialized kinesiology course..

loans.name: Battseren

texts.en:
Mrs. Battseren is 43 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in a ger (traditional Mongolian yurt [tent]) in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her husband, Ganbaatar, works as driver for the railway company. Her oldest child, Suhbat, age 26, works at a local company, while Uuganbayar, age 22, Purevsuren, age 20, and Davaasuren, age 18, are university students. Batsuh, age 8, goes to the local primary school.

Battseren started her own retail business of selling clothing from home 4 months ago. She has worked as a saleswoman for several years and has experience in the business. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory to run her business smoothly. She is a hardworking, enthusiastic and diligent woman who says, "I want all my children grown, educated, and able to live on their own."

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run her business smoothly.

loans.name: Tunda

texts.en: Tunda made progress from the previous loans as follows: She has increased her working capital, bought more fish and onions, etc., and she has paid part of her children's school fees. She is now taking another loan to increase her business stock and buy more fish. She is happy for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more items for her store, including fish and onions.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joice has been operating a retail shop business selling charcoal from home to her neighbors and passersby. She cited stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. Her dream is to establish real estate houses in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman with three school-aged children.She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to generate more profits to earn a living. She dreams of expanding her business and educating her children to become useful people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to generate more profits to earn a living.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 40 years old from Gaza. She is married and has six children, four in school. She works in the family house sewing embroidery on clothes, shoes and bags. She asked Ryada for this loan to buy sewing machines to support her embroidery work. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her income and improve her situation which will help her move to her own house.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines to support her embroidery work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, es una mujer de 41 años,esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Nelly, dedica su tiempo de trabajo a la venta de bebidas gasificadas de todos los sabores y tamaños además de deliciosas golosinas que deleitan el paladar de niños y adultos como galletas, caramelos, chicles, chizitos y chocolates. Ha acondicionado su puesto de ventas en su casa y ahí atiende todos los días, algunas veces con la ayuda de su cónyuge o en ocasiones también recibe el apoyo de sus hijos. Abastece su negocio comprando de manera semanal o quincenal todo lo que necesita para poner a la venta. Su humilde puesto de ventas esta frente a un colegio el cual le permite tener clientes a lo largo del día. Lleva 20 años en esta actividad y sus ganancias han sido muy favorables desde que empezó a desarrollar su negocio. Eventualmente complementa su actividad con la venta de plátanos y otros productos regionales.Su trabajo le permite cubrir los gastos básicos de su hogar y se siente bien porque puede colaborar con su esposo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.600 soles para la compra de bebidas gasificadas, galletas, caramelos , entre otros productos que le ayudaran a implementar su negocio, a su vez se muestra agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibira y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Nelly is a 41 year old woman who is married and has 3 children living with her in her own home.  Nelly spends her time working as a saleswoman selling all different flavors and sizes of sodas, as well as delicious sweets which delight the palates of both children and adults, such as cookies, caramels, gum, cheese puffs, and chocolates.  She has created a concession stand at her house, and she works there every day, sometimes with the help of her spouse or on occasion her children help out as well.

She restocks her stand on a weekly or bi-weekly basis, buying everything she needs to fill her stand.  Her humble little stand is across the street from a school, which gives her a stream of customers throughout the day.  She has spent the past 20 years in this business and her profits have been quite good ever since she started to grow her stand.  Eventually, she began to expand her offerings with the sale of bananas and other local products.  Her work allows her to pay for the essential costs of her household and feel good because she can work with her husband. 

She is requesting 600 Soles to purchase carbonated beverages, cookies, candies, and other products to help her supplement her business, she is grateful for the financial support she will receive and agrees to pay her loan back punctually.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks, cookies, caramels, and other items.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona se dedica a la venta de chipas y gracias a su crédito anterior de Kiva pudo seguir con su producción. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con gran esfuerzo y empeño esta saliendo adelante. Su esposo también la ayuda en lo que puede.
Ella esta agradecida, ya que gracias a su anterior crédito ha podido crecer un poco más y mejorar también su producción. Hoy solicita de un nuevo crédito para la compra de quesos, harina, almidón, levaduras, huevos y otros con lo cual seguirá con su producción de chipas. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
Ramona makes a living cooking and selling delicious chipas (local, traditional cheesey-bread creations), and thanks to her previous Kiva loan, she has been able to continue with her business. She is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business and supporting her family. Her husband also helps out with household expenses as he is able.

Thanks to her previous loan, Ramona has expanded and improved her overall business as well as the quality of her products. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase cheese, flour, starch, yeast, eggs and other ingredients for making her delicious chipas. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, flour, starch, yeast, eggs and other ingredients for making her food items.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Essi est une femme âgée de 29ans. Mère de 02 enfants scolarisés, Essi est revendeuse de pagnes à domicile et de façon ambulante. Pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients, elle sollicite son cinquième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des  pagnes. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra d’avoir une boutique de pagnes et construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en: Essi is a 29-year-old woman and the mother of two children, who are in school. Essi sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) out of her home and by going door to door. To respond to the needs of her customers, she is requesting her fifth WAGES loan to purchase some 'pagne' cloth. The profit derived from the sales will enable her to have a fabrics store and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 31 years old  and from Ramallah, Palestine. He is married and has one child. He has owned a carpentry business since January 2012 and has 14 years experience in the same field.

Ahmad has asked Ryada for a loan in order to buy an iron saw and carpentry kit for his carpentry workshop. He hopes that this loan will help increase his productivity and improve his income to provide his family with a better, more stable financial life.

loans.use: to buy an iron saw and carpentry kit for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a single mother of four children who all go to school. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. She works in a shop that she rents six days out of every week. Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a bridal salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids,

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 30 years old and lives in Kutaisi District with her husband, sister and her two children. Maka’s husband is a sailor. Maka requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Maka requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Maka will begin trading in clothing and household goods. She plans to go to Turkey and purchase clothing and household goods at wholesale prices and then resell in Kutaisi. She will do her best to increase the income of her family and improve the living conditions for her children. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the life of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothing and household goods

loans.name: Aa'yad

texts.en:
Aa'yad is 36 years old from Gaza, and lives with her brother in the family house. She asked Ryada for this start-up loan in order to open her own grocery store and to buy food and goods and to install shelves for her first project. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and be able to approach her dream of having her own house.
Ryada's start-up loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest his or her own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three-month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to open her own grocery store and to buy food and goods and to install shelves for her first project

loans.name: Vobononme 11 Group

texts.fr: VOBONONME 11 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres habitent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, Salimathou est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Salimathou est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à Moussa. Salimathou a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Salimathou et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Salimathou assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Salimathou vend des chaussures dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Salimathou et les autres membres du groupe VOBONONME 11 sollicitent pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
VOBONONME 11 is a group of three persons whose members live in the same area. The group's representative, Salimathou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Salimathou is 27 years old and married to Moussa. She has attended primary school. The couple has three children, not all in school, and two are dependents. Salimathou and her husband live together with their children. Together with her husband, she ensures that the different household expenses are covered. 

Salimathou sells shoes at a market in Benin. This business enables her to meet her needs and those of her children without much difficulty. She and the other members of the group VOBONONME 11 are requesting an initial loan, financial support from ALIDé, with the aim of bolstering their business and responding better to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Yelkoto Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZETO est responsable du groupe YELKOTO. Mariée, elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 37ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. Cinq (05) de ses enfants vont à l’école.
Mme vend diverses  marchandises (céréales, savons etc.) depuis 30ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les village. Ses clients sont lkes hommes et femmes. 
Elle  veut s’acheter 01sac de mil, 01sac de maïs et 02 cartons de savons.
Avec ses épargnes, elle veut aider sa famille (scolarisation des enfants). Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique(magasin) de céréales
texts.en:
Ms. AZETO is the official of the group YELKOTO. She is the married mother of seven children. The oldest is 37 years old, and the youngest is 17. Five of her children attend school. 

Ms. AZETO has been selling a variety of goods (grains, soaps, etc.) for thirty years. She gets her supplies from villages. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase a sack of millet, a sack of corn, and two boxes of soaps.

With her savings, she wants to help out her family (schooling for the children). Her ambition is to open a grains shop (store) selling grains.

loans.use: to purchase millet, corn, and soap

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. His wife, Bayasgalan, helps her husband to run their family shoe-making business from home and she has started a clothes retail business at a rental counter in the local market. Batbaatar's daughter Nandintsetseg and his son Batnairamdal go to local schools. Batbaatar has been running his cobbling business at home since 2004. He has built a closer relationship with his customers and suppliers over the years and is well-known in town with his good-quality and well-designed shoes. 

Batbaatar is now requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of materials to produce more shoes to sell to local customers. He and his wife both are hardworking, diligent people.

Picture of the borrower is taken in his wife's clothes retail at local market.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of materials to produce more shoes to sell to local customers

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu has been operating a dairy farming business, selling from home to neighbors and passersby. Tabu mentioned that disease and drought are the major challenges in the farming business. She dreams of purchasing cattle and expanding her dairy farming in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal to establish a charcoal-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal to establish a charcoal-selling business.

loans.name: Gaielle

texts.en:
Gaielle is a 21-year-old, married woman, a mother of one child. She has been working in the beauty business for four years. Gaielle helps her husband in making their living to make sure that her child will have a brighter future. 

Gaielle is a hard worker with a very good experience in her business. She likes her work a lot and enjoys turning every woman beautiful.

Gaielle is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to update her business with special, newly-released tools, to stay updated, and to better respond to her customers' needs.

Gaielle is intending to provide her child with the best education ever. That's why she puts so much effort into developing her business, to make sure that it will always create a very good income to cover the really expensive educational fees. She hopes to keep on pleasing her customers, developing her business, and responding to her precious family's needs.

loans.use: to update her business with special, newly-released tools.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver  is married with four children, two in school. She sells charcoal and has been in this business for 13 years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through poultry farming and renting houses. She works from her home and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own 3,500 chickens and also to build more rental rooms.She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Akpenin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKPENIN est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Thèrèse, est âgée 57 ans. Thèrèse est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Thèrèse est mariée à un certain Eric. Le couple à six enfants, dont trois à leur charge,et tous scolarisés. Thèrèse et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Thèrèse n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Thèrèse vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, haricot), ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Thèrèse désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Thèrèse sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPENIN , un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group AKPENIN comprises three persons who live in the same district. The group's representative, Thèrèse, is 57 years old. She is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is married to a man named Eric. The couple have six children, of whom three are in their care; all have had schooling. Thèrèse and her husband live together and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Thèrèse did not attend school. She sells food (rice, corn mash, beans), and this enables her to respond to family needs without much difficulty. 

Concerned about further satisfying her customers, Thèrèse would like to bolster her business. To do so, she and the other members of the group AKPENIN are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, corn, and condiments

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en: Zaituni is a single mother of five children, four in school. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has applied for a loan of 900000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of pineapples, sweet bananas, mangoes, oranges and apples. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works at the market seven days out of every week, selling on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes seasonality, perishable food and thieves. She wants to start growing some of the fruits, become a wholesaler and also see her children go up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas, baskets of pineapples, mangoes, oranges and apples.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is 49 years old. She lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. She works as a waitress at a local restaurant and earns a small monthly income. Madona requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Madona requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Madona will trade with clothing and household goods. She will go to Turkey and purchase clothing and household goods from the wholesalers and then resale them in Tbilisi. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading with clothing and household goods

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas is 30 years old, from Gaza. She has owned a small shop for selling home products and appliances since January 2011.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy home appliances and to install shelves and a glass door for her shop. 

Inas hopes that this loan will help her increase her sales and, thus, improve her income.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and to install shelves and a glass door for her shop.

loans.name: Marame's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 le groupe au sein du banc villageois de Dabo compte 05 femmes qui de par leur travail et sérieux ont atteint le second produit qu’offre le programme. Elles ont à leur actif plus de 3 cycles et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Marame  (debout à l’extrême gauche) est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de  53 ans, mariée et mère de cinq  enfants dont 02 garçons et trois filles âgés de 02 à 15 ans. Elle est vendeuse  de tissus teintés appelé communément « thioub » qu’elle achète dans la sous région pour la vente a dans les autres régions plus particulièrement dans la capitale. Elle a aussi comme activité secondaire la vente d’encens. 

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte financer son prochain voyage en vu de mieux s’approvisionner  en « thioub »  et autres divers produits appréciés par ses clients.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront en plus d’apporter son soutien dans le foyer, mieux assister ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Created on July 12, 2008, this group within the 'banc villageois' of Dabo comprises five women who, by their work and determination, have attained the second product the program offers. The women have the advantage of more than three [loan] cycles and are mainly active in small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Marame (standing at the far left in the photo) is the featured borrower of the group. She is the 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children, including two boys and three girls, from 2 to 15 years old. Marame sells dyed cloth commonly called 'thioub' which she purchases in a sub-region to sell in other regions, particularly in the capital. She also has a secondary business selling incense. 

With her new loan, she intends to finance her next trip with the aim of better supplying herself with 'thioub' and various other products appreciated by her customers. 

The profit from this business will enable her not only to help support her household but also to help with her children's schooling more.

loans.use: to finance her next trip to stock up on 'thioub' and various other products her customers appreciate

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es: Rogelia, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 7 hijos, reside en una aldea rural del municipio de Intibucá. Desde muy joven ha trabajado en la agricultura con su familia. Hace más de 18 años que comenzó a realizar actividades que le generen ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos y decidió elaborar tamales para vender. Los tamales los hace a base de maíz rellenos con carne de pollo, papas, arroz, chicharos y otros, envueltos en hojas de banano. Es un tamal muy rico y los vende en la esquina del mercado o ambulante. Para mantener su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 3,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar los materiales e insumos para elaborar los tamales para vender. Ella quiere incrementar la producción para mejorar los ingresos. Su sueño es trabajar mucho para poder comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa y tener mejor nivel de vida con sus hijos.
texts.en: Rogelia, who is 30 years old, is single and the mother of 7 children and lives in a rural area of the Intibucá municipality.  Since she was very young, she has worked in farming with her family.  For the past 18 years, she has also begun to do other activities in order to make an income to sustain her children and she decided to make tamales for sale.  She makes her tamales out of a corn dough and stuffs them with meat, chicken, potatoes, chicharrones (fried pork skin), and other ingredients, wrapped in banana leaves.  It's a delicious tamale and she sells them in the corner of the marketplace or on foot.  To maintain her business, she has decided to ask for a loan of 3,000 Lempiras, with which to buy materials and groceries to make her tamales for sale.  She want to increase her production and her profits.  Her dream is to work a lot in order to buy a piece of land and construct her own house and have a better life with her children.

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, rice, potatoes, and other groceries to make traditional tamales for sale.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Progreso” está trabajando junto y ya están en ciclo numero 6. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan por sus familias, para poder darles todo lo que necesitas para una vida sin limitaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rufina, tesorera del grupo, quien en su última encuesta  de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les ayuda a conocer el nivel de sus ingresos, mostró que ella esta en un nivel superior, superando así sus ingresos, todo esto gracias al trabajo continuo y dedicación constante. Ella se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos,  además de eso también hace comestibles para poder venderlos y así seguir ganado los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
La señora solicita  este crédito para la compra de productos para su despensa (artículos de librería), lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a tener  más cliente e  ingresos.
texts.en:
The group, "El Progreso" (Progress), is presently in their sixth business cycle and is made up of eleven women who work extremely hard to support their families and give their loved ones a bright future.

Rufina, one of the group members, also serves as treasurer of the group. In the most recent poverty elimination survey that Rufina took as part of the group program, her results indicated that she has worked hard and has leveraged support from group trainings to help improve her family's financial situation. Rufina makes a living operating a general store that sells all types of products, and she also cooks traditional food items for resale to help support her family.

With the support from this loan, Rufina plans to purchase merchandise, specifically school and office supplies, to stock her store. She hopes that this investment will help her to improve the selection of products she offers her customers and will increase her overall profits and income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is married with four children, three in school. She has a business of selling half bricks and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for loan of 1,100,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more half bricks. She sells on wholesale basis only and works seven days out of every week.  She generates additional income through a beauty salon. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation and also to own many standalone dryers. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more half bricks for sale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in furniture making for seven years. In 2009, he opened his own business to improve his living standard.
Ahmad is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary raw materials that will improve the finishing quality of his products, such as paints, sponges, and wood in addition to special furniture accessories.
He will also invest part of this loan to do some maintenance to his house because he plans to get married soon.
He is so anxious to make a family of his own and, at the same time, he will make sure that they will have the best standard of living possible.
He hopes to keep on expanding and developing his business toward opening a bigger factory in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials for his furniture business

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Maria de 58 años de edad se dedica a vender pupusas en su lugar de residencia desde hace 5 años, vende por las mañanas y por las noches tiene mucha clientela ya que es muy amable y vende sus pupusas a un buen precio, vive con su esposo, su hijo y un nieto, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo y su hijo han logrado salir adelante en los gastos del hogar, Doña Maria quiere mejorar su negocio pero no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder hacerlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar lo necesario como: maiz, frijoles, chicharron, quesillo, y todo lo que se ocupa para la elaboracion de las pupusas para poder seguir trabajando y tener satisfechos siempre a sus clientes y asi pueda tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran en los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar.
texts.en:
María, 58, has been working selling pupusas [grilled, filled corn cakes] at home for the last five years; she sells during the morning and at night has many customers because she’s very kind and sells the pupusas at a good price.  She lives with her husband, son and a grandson.  With the profits she earns she helps her husband and her son.  They’ve managed to handle household expenses.

María wants to improve her business but does not have sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking for a loan to be able to buy what she needs like corn, beans, fried pork, string cheese and everything else needed to make pupusas so that she can stay in business and always keep her customers satisfied thus being able to earn higher profits that will help with any household expenses that might arise.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Om-Dlal Group

texts.en:
Om-Dlal is a group consisting of four ladies who live in Dhamar, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Naem is a 35-year-old married woman and has 5 children. She works hard and does her best to provide her family with food and clothing. She is a housewife and dreams of raising her children well. She lives with her family in bad conditions, and she would like to buy construction supplies to use in her small house, but she suffers from a lack of money. So she is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use in her small house.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is 35 years old and she is married with four children who are in school. They all live in Montserrado County, which is the number one commercial city in Liberia since it is the capital city of Liberia. She is a high school graduate. For five years she has been involved in the sale of shoes. Most interestingly, she has many customers because she sells quality products. She started her business with a loan from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends.

She spends eight hours a day on her business. Because the location of her shop is a bit far from her house, one of the problems she faces is vehicle traffic. Sometimes she is late in getting her shop open. She is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes (footwear) to expand her business. She plans to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes (footwear) to expand her business.

loans.name: Naomi W.

texts.en:
Naomi is 33 years old. She is married, with two children who are in school and are between 5 and 12 years old. They all live in Montserrado County which is noted as the commercial city in Liberia. 

Naomi is a high school graduate. For two years now, she has been involved in the sales of fashion clothes, such as blouses, jeans, trousers, and dresses. Most interestingly, she has many customers since she sells quality products. She started her business with a loan from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends 12 hours on her business since her house is closer to her shop. One of the problems she faces is transportation costs. 

Naomi is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, dresses) to increase her sales. She plans to open another shop in the near future and to see her children out of college.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (blouses, jeans trouser, dresses) to increase her sales.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: La Señora Xiomara es responsable de una escuela publica donde asisten niños de 3 a 6 años denominados preescolares, desde hace mas de 17 años, es su segundo crédito que tiene con ceprodel y lo utilizara para compra de: materiales de construcción: zinc, ladrillos, cementos y otros materiales para realizar mejora en su casa de habitación lo cual la beneficiaria con mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
For the past 17 years, Xiomara has been the head of a public school for children 3 to 6 years old, that is, preschoolers.  

This is her second loan with CEPRODEL, and she will use it to purchase:  construction materials:  metal roofing, bricks, cement and other materials to make improvements to her home, which will provide better living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing, bricks, cement and other materials.

loans.name: Hever

texts.es:
Hever es casado y tiene una hija de 3 meses, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Las Nieves de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la recolección (compra) de material reciclable como ser: papel, periódicos, latas de cerveza, cobre, libros que la gente ya no utiliza, etc., para su venta a las fábricas que usan estos materiales.
El crédito lo requiere para  el aumento de capital; así adquirirá cobre y otros objetos de metal.
El sueño de Hever  es tener una cadena de sitios de acopio de material reciclable. De esta manera incrementará sus ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Hever is married and has a three-month-old daughter. They live in his parents home, which is located in the Villa Las Nieves area of the city of La Paz.

He completed a secondary level education and currently works collecting (purchasing) recyclable materials like paper, newspapers, beer cans, copper, books that people no longer use, etc. He sells them to the factories that use these materials.

He is requesting this loan to increase capital; he will acquire copper and other metal objects. Hever' dream is to own a chain of recyclable material collection sites. This will allow his income to increase. 

This is the first time he is requesting a loan through IMPRO and his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of recyclable materials to sell to the factories that use them.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 33-year-old from Gaza. She is married and has 8 children, five of whom go to school. She owns a shop for selling perfumes, accessories and women's clothing.

She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy goods and shelves for the store she owns. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her family's income and thus provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: to buy goods and shelves for the store she owns.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 68 years old, married, and has one adult child. He is retired and lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi. Robert requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family's main source of income is Robert’s and his wife Salome’s monthly pensions. In addition, they have a commercial space, which is rented out as a grocery shop and they receive a small monthly payment. Total income of the family is so small that it is not enough to cover their monthly expenses, including food. 

Robert's loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit, being regarded as “high risk borrowers.” With the loan, Robert will purchase grocery stocks. He wants to stop renting his commercial space and use it to open a grocery shop himself. This business will be profitable as the shop is already well known by locals. He plans on reinvesting the profit and purchasing more varieties of products to attract more customers, which will significantly increase the income of the family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stock and open a grocery shop

loans.name: Finanfa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  FINANFA est formé de deux personnes qui  sont des cohabitantes. La représentante de ce groupe,  nommée Rosaline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Rosaline est âgée de 30 ans, est  mariée à un certain Dohou. Le couple a deux enfants,dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges du foyer. Rosaline n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a vingt ans que Rosaline exerce comme activité, la vente des plateaux d’œufs et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Rosaline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Rosaline désire acheter des plateaux d’œufs et du charbon de bois pour renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Rosaline sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FINANFA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group FINANFA comprises two persons who live together. The group's representative, Rosaline, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 30 years old and married to a man named Dohou. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school; both are in their care. The couple live together and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. 

Rosaline did not attend school. For twenty years, she has had a business selling trays of eggs and charcoal out of her home. This enables her to respond to family needs without much difficulty. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

Concerned about responding better to the requirements of her customers, Rosaline would like to purchase trays of eggs and some charcoal to bolster her business. To do so, she and the other members of the group FINANFA are requesting an initial loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and some charcoal

loans.name: Susana Manoela

texts.es: Susana de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 13 años ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa  donde vende ropa para damas, ropa para niños y caballeros, sabanas, cubrecamas, entre otras cosas (asi como lo muestra la foto) desde hace 7 años y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias y con eso ha podido salir adelante con su hijo y a solventado los gastos que se le presentan, esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susana, 36, lives in her own home with her 13 year-old child.  She has a business selling clothing.  She's been selling clothing for men, women and children, bed sheets, bedspreads, and other items (as is shown in the photo) for 7 years.  This has given her sales experience, which enables her to obtain the best earnings.  With this business, she has been able to get ahead with her child and cover the expenses that occur.  

Susana's business is located in her home, and is well-known by the neighbors in the area.  She has gained a lot of customers.  She wants to grow the business and to make a new investment, but she needs capital.  This is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy the products she needs for her store.  This way, she will obtain the best earnings so that she can give her child a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing to stock her business

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 23-year-old single man who has been working in furniture-making and selling flowers for eight years. He is employed in both businesses to make sure that his income is good enough to cover his expenses and his family's, too, at the same time.

He believes that he is creative enough to succeed in his own business, but he has a financial problem that was stopping him from making his dream come true. Therefore, Alaa is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to start a small business of his own for additional income. He is often asked to do the flower decorations for weddings, and he is planning to expand this business to open a wedding planning company in the future.

loans.use: to start his own business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
For the past several years Sharon has operated an ice block selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Apart from that she runs a business of water distribution. She faces the major challenges of seasonality and competition in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income.
